review.title: Nothing to say , non descript
review.reviewText: Typical low level airport hotel . Staff ok , but facilities very tired . Expensive for the poor overall quality . Staff in the main helpful.

managementResponses.response: Hello and thank you for your feedback.  We are very surprised to read your comments - we do not get negative reviews like this. We take pride in the cleanliness of our hotel and our rooms and have done many renovations - I am sorry you didn't care for your room.  The taxi fare sounds accurate to go to San Francisco.  For future reference, you can always take our complimentary shuttle to SFO, then catch BART.  I am sorry for any inconveniences and hope you give us another try.  Jim McGuire, General Manager

review.title: Worst Hotel Ever
review.reviewText:
This is the worst hotel I've ever stayed in,I wouldn't recommend it to anyone !
Room dated,water pressure appalling,bath shower tiles black covered in mold,you didn't even get proper coffee making facilities,powered milk,what a joke
Staff around hotel struggled to smile,except one lad at the reception desk.
The hotel recommended a taxi(theirs I think) into San Fransico at $55,cost us $40 to get back !

Tip. For anybody booking this hotel on line,Check the price !!

My quote for TWO nights was just over $500 my bill (with ALL the added taxes) for TWO nights,no extras was $710.98 Unbeliveable for a place like this.
review.negativeRemarks: See above
review.locationRemarks: N/A

managementResponses.response: Hello and thank you for your comments.  I am sorry that you had to wait to check in.  We cannot guarantee early check-ins, but we do the best we can to accommodate them.  We hope you give us another try in the future.  Jim McGuire, GM

review.title: Nice hotel near  SFO
review.reviewText: THE hotel was good.  There was a breakdown at check in.  We had called and we were told a room would be available.  We arrived around 4 and they did NOT have a room.  They did not come up with a workable solution as we just wanted to change clothes and leave for our event nor did they offer any form of compensation.  There was no acknowledgement of our inconvenience.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for your nice comments on your recent stay.  For future reference, our seasonal outdoor pool is heated at 85 degrees.  You will have to come back to try it!  We appreciate your feedback.
Jim McGuire, General Manager

review.title: Airport hotel
review.reviewText:
The positives:
Compared to most hotels in the San Francisco area it was reasonably priced.
The negatives:
Room was a bit on the small side. Traffic noise from freeway. Complimentary breakfast was rubbish. Bartender was more than useless.
Conclusion:
Unless you really need to be close to the airport stay in Oakland. The traffic across the bridge isn't as bad as you think.
review.negativeRemarks:
The breakfast food
The quality of drinks served at the bar by employing a proper bartender
review.locationRemarks:
Unless you like watching planes taking off and landing there is nothing nearby.
San Francisco is about 10 miles north.

I appreciated a lot that we came early, arrive in the hotel at 9:30 a.m.  I wasn't expected to get a room,
but we are lucky, there was one room available. The lady in the counter is very nice, we 
can check in immediately, that I said thousand thanks to her. if not, we have to wait till 3:00 p.m. 
They are very nice to try to accommodate what we need.

review.title: Clean comfortable airport hotel
review.reviewText:
Free shuttle to and from the airport. Clean comfortable and very welcoming. Front of house and restaurant staff had the usual American welcome that was very good. No attitude just great service. Usual US hotel free internet is a real positive for UK travellers. 
My room was on 6th floor, very clean comfortable and well appointed. Good air conditioning Filter coffee maker in room with powder creamer - not good for English tea. Fridge in room too 
Only negative was the road noise from freeway - Windows only single glazed so bring earplugs if like me you're a light sleeper 

Breakfast simple but plentiful fresh buffet style 
Definitely recommend to overnight or even city tourists as the price was about half of city centre hotel at same standard.

managementResponses.response: Hi Tezzy and thank you for your nice comments on our hotel, and thank you for your continued patronage!  Please try our restaurant for dinner - you will be pleasantly surprised.  We appreciate your feedback!  Jim McGuire, General Manager

Since then the hotel has been renovated and also the menu has changed so who knows.

review.title: It's okay
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice but the breakfast was a bit disgusting. The eggs are uncooked and the water taste nasty. The silver wear was gross not washed correctly. The cups and plates stink horrible. I Recommend not to eat breakfast there at all unless you want a bagel with cream cheese. The room was nice but the cups were dirty and stinked. Whoever washes dishes needs to do a better job period. The staff when I came in lied to me that there wasn't any place to buy food walking distance , when McDonald's was across the street (found out the next day). Plus I came to check in at night so you can't see much especially inside the shuttle bus which was great. Had to spend about 75 dollars on dinner inside the hotel. I didn't like the service when I came in from the two young females. Yeah so at the end I'll give this hotel overall a 2.5.

i couldn't sleep well because nosy of heater. There is nosy from other room too.

review.title: Convenient and close to airport.
review.reviewText: We had a great time.  The room was comfortable and the breakfast was great.

review.title: Nice hotel at the airport.
review.reviewText: Welcoming staff despite arrival at 2:30 in the morning. Parked right in front. Good night's sleep; no detectable outside noise, despite location. Inside corridors and sound proof walls. Great breakfast with hot and cold foods and drinks. Clean. Nice shower with safety/grab bars.
review.locationRemarks: SFO. San Francisco International Airport, freeways. Noise free inside.

review.title: Not worth value for the price paid
review.reviewText:
I stayed 4 nights at the hotel. It was not as good as expected. First, they charge parking fees at the hotel, make sure you read carefully before booking. 
Secondly, there's literally no restaurant nearby, very inconvenient. The restaurant at the hotel wasn't that good.
I found a spider in my room. 
The insulation is so bad that you can hear pretty much everything next door, one day I woke up by the screams from a baby at 4-5 am in the morning.
The breakfast is not as good as other Best Western hotel that I stayed.

review.title: Need serious remodeling.
review.reviewText: very old construction. Room was very small for 2 beds. Bathroom was even smaller with this constant nasty smell. Carpet was even worse. You can see the drastic change in color when I pushed one of the furniture pieces. Bathroom door will not even close all the way and had to be pushed in. Once that, it was a battle pulling it open. I was about 6 doors away from the elevator but could hear the ding every 5 minutes m the only highlight was the friendly staff or the breakfast.I would've paid a bit more to stay at holiday inn across the street.

photos.caption: Our second room, water coming in and wet from the inside.

review.title: Dingy hotel, small rooms
review.reviewText:
The lobby is very nice. The room we were given had a window which latch was broken and curtains were ripped. We asked for a new room since we couldn't lock the window. We were given a new room immediately.  Theven new room had light bulbs that were out, the fan in the bathroom wasn't working and that night after it rained when we woke up we noticed that the window was broken,  water came in the room making the room humid.  We did not want to move rooms again, we did not want to experience something good worse and we were already unpacked again.
The rooms are dingy and very small. We stayed at the Best Western in Monterey on our way up to San Fransisco  and their rooms cleanliness and spaciousness was incomparable to these rooms. 
The full breakfast was great as well as our housekeeper.  We will definitely not stay at this hotel in the future or recommend!  Since we had prepaid with Expedia they could not do anything at the front desk , however they did comp us for the 7.00 per day parking.

review.title: NEVER AGAIN.
review.reviewText:
Let me start with the positives - the front desk staff is absolutely lovely. Very friendly and accommodating. The breakfast buffet was good, though the hotel was packed and the dining room not equipped to deal with the number of visitors. 
We were stuck on a floor with a tour group of teenagers. Our neighbors were so loud we heard every word of their conversation and the television program that was blaring. At 9:30, we asked for another room and were moved to the opposite side of the hall where a party was raging. UGH. The bed was rock hard and the pillows had seen better days. The windows rattled at random times and there was an unexplained draft in the second room. The airport noise that I expected to be the biggest problem was no more than a blip on the radar at that point. 
We tossed and turned through the night and went down to breakfast in the morning, only to find a packed to capacity dining room and a picked over buffet. No mugs for coffee. Most of the offerings were already gone at 8:30 (the buffet was 6-10).  
I will never stay in a Best Western again.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms were clean. The staff was friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: The beds are atrocious. The sheets are like sandpaper. Be prepared for large groups in the dining area.

review.title: Great
review.reviewText: Great, excellent housekeeping, staff.Enjoyed utilizing your fitness center

review.title: Very pleasant hotel with kind, helpful staff.
review.reviewText: Our visit was due to a friend having a heart valve replacement.  There were difficultys involving the scheduling of the operation and the hotel staff helped to accommodate our situation.  The hotel's breakfasts and dinner service were were great assets during our stay.

review.title: South San Francisco
review.reviewText: Close to airport but not too noisy, decent breakfast buffet, bathroom very small and parking limited. Nice lounge but closes at midnight.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to airport away from the heavy traffic in San Francisco.

review.locationRemarks: Everything just be prepared to be stuck in traffic.

review.reviewText: Stayed for a total of 5 nights and didn't encounter a single issue. Comfortable bed, friendly staff, and convenient location!

review.title: Average hotel very close to airport
review.reviewText: This is older hotel that could use some cleaning and update.  the room that we stayed in was on fifth floor and one of its windows was not properly sealed making the hizzing sound at night from the wind.  It took me a little while to fall asleep.  Hotel has no microwave in room and laundry room close at 10 so somewhat of a inconvenience.
Hotel looks dated though overall, it was a pleasant stay for a short time.
review.negativeRemarks: We didn't get to use the amenities during our brief stay though the facilities looked dated.   Overall, it was a pleasant stay.  Thanks

review.title: Ok for a night's stay near airport
review.reviewText: Good enough stay for a night to catch an early flight. Front desk staff was very helpful. Lobby had the smell of cleaning chemicals, as did the room. Bed was quite comfortable, room size was not bad. As we had a 7AM flight, we really appreciated the to-go breakfast bags (fruit, danish, juice, granola bar).
review.positiveRemarks: Front desk staff, to-go breakfast bag
review.negativeRemarks: Smell of the lobby and room
review.locationRemarks: Near airport

review.reviewText: Room was small, and the facilities were old.  Breakfast could be improved.

review.title: Clean, convenient hotel with friendly staff.
review.reviewText: They provide airport transportation and have a nice restaurant on site.  I would recommend this hotel for the value received for the cost.

Pleasant stay. Awesome breakfast. 
Will come back again

review.title: Nice hotel close to airport
review.reviewText: Clean, nicely updated hotel close to airport. Not much else in the area but if you need to be close to the airport this place is a good one.
It was a nice stay, staff were nice and the food is great.
Quick check in, great customer service, friendly staff. Great buffet breakfast and the restaurant and bar is convenient. Plus there is a Costco less than half a mile down the street!

review.title: Nice Hotel at San Francisco Airport
review.reviewText: Nice Hotel at the Airport. Our own experience was pretty good. Our room was upgraded to a suite on arrival which was great. The suite was very large and comfortable. Staff were very helpful and pleasant. For us it was great value. On the negative side slightly frustrating that one of the TVs didn't work and the room was very noisy due to the fact that being on the 3rd floor it was right next to the hotel air conditioning fan units. For us being exhausted after a flight from the UK it didn't really keep us awake, but it was loud. The hotel is near the main highway and airport so at times again a lot of noise. Bed base also was creaky.  Breakfast was OK, bizarrely the lady at the breakfast buffet seem to want to ration the teabags so they constantly were empty. Not sure why. Overall it was a comfortable hotel and very well run. For us we were very well treated and would recommend the hotel, however stay higher than the 3rd floor !!
review.positiveRemarks: Room we had was huge and comfortable. Shuttle service to Airport
review.negativeRemarks: Window sound proofing. It was a noisy location as you would expect for an airport hotel
review.locationRemarks: Near San Francisco Airport in South Francisco. Very limited restaurants in the area. All hotels

review.title: Needed something close to airport for layover
review.reviewText: Just needed something close to airport. Great confident shuttle to/from
review.positiveRemarks: Staff / reception area were wonderfully pleasant, dining room ehh.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleaner rooms, recent tv broadcast show of what to look for at hotels, when I pulled the sheets down there was obvious hair that did not come from me

review.title: Vacation
review.reviewText: Me and my best friend stayed here for the weeknd and we loved it the view was amazing and room was really nice we were surprised when we walked into the doors to see waterfalls bar and restaurant.

review.title: Was ok

Most travelers, business or leisure, are most often drawn in hotels that include a hot breakfast, especially coffee, in the room rate.

review.reviewText:

review.title: Close to SFO with Free Shuttle
review.reviewText: Good comfy Hotel with free wifi, close to SFO with free shuttle and BART Station the connects you with SF.

review.title: Nice hotel near SF airport
review.reviewText: generally speaking this hotel is okay, the bed cover and sheet is clean, but the  washing towel are old, a little dirty. The cafertiria waiter is not professional.

review.title: Comfort and personable staff at a good price!
review.reviewText: I was happy with this hotel for the price. The single room was big and fully equipped. The bed was huge, comfortable and most importantly clean. Took me some time to get used to the elevator bell and fridge noise. I really like the staff, friendly and funny. I had some good conversations with them at the bar. The breakfast buffet is not bad, considering it's free. There isn't much around since it's an industrial area. But, parking is cheap and there's easy access to highways- so get a rental. They also have shuttle to the airport, so you can grab BART rail into town.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom sink was in a cramped space and the spout was too short. The shower pressure/heat wasn't as high as I would like.
review.locationRemarks: Not much around. There's a McDonalds across the street which is fine by me. There's also a See's candy factory right next door, buy buy buy!

On second day same deal with pillows no coffee service. dinner still barely warm .  Breakfast much the sameeggs were good tho.last day no sheets on bed I give up i'll stay elsewhere next time.

review.positiveRemarks: Clean, comfortable, reasonable rate, friendly staff and convenient shuttle service.

review.reviewText:

The interior of the hotel is OK better than many other more expensive hotels. The room and the bathroom was very clean, plenty of towels, an iron, and free strong WiFi. The reception and the room service was also very good. Breakfast was OK, no specialties but reasonable for such a hotel. I highly recommend it as a good value to stay near the airport.

review.title: Overnight at SFO

My children wanted to study for their Monday exam coz were watching TV in our room and it disturb them. They ask permission from the check in counter and they were allowed to stay there. But this mean Man shooed them away. He put my children at risk when they need to go to Mc Do instead of keeping them safely inside the hotel. That man should learn customer care.

So once we settled in our room we asked for extra blanket since we only have two beds. The lady at the desk answered and she said she will send someone them to our room. We even ready our gratis for whoever was bringing our blankets... No blankets were delivered and we called after more than an hour and a gentleman answered and apologized about it. Other than that we our satisfied with the service.

review.title: OK for a short stay
review.reviewText: Booked the room through Expedia and when we got there they did not have the room type we had booked. In fact, they supposedly only had one room left which was between the ice maker and the elevator, both of which are noisy. The shuttle doesn't run 24 hours a day so we had to pay for a cab back to the hotel when we returned the rental car. The room was ok from a cleanly standpoint. The couch and chairs were old and disgusting and I wouldn't have wanted to sit on either. I had to disconnect the bathroom fan as it was just humming and burning out, didn't actually work. I was afraid of a fire so I disconnected it. When I told the front desk clerk the next morning he said ok, that's no problem. How about Oh we'll make sure we get that fixed? At least the bathroom was clean and the sheets appeared clean. The towels were all stained. Overall, considering the prices of hotels in San Fran, this was reasonable and close to the airport which is all we were looking for. I would recommend it for that but not as a place to stay for more than one quick night.
review.negativeRemarks: Furniture in suites replaced, new towels and duvet cover that aren't stained.
review.locationRemarks: Airport is close and that's all I cared about.

review.title: A comfortable and accommodating hotel
review.reviewText: The Best Western Grosvner is convenient and comfortable. It is set up for travelers using the San Francico Airport and makes the experience comfortable and easy. Charge for parking while you are on your trip is $10 a day. There is a shuttle to deliver and pick up passengers at the atrport. The rooms are comfortable and though it is next to the freeway and the airport, it is quiet. The staff is friendly and knowledgable. Breakfast buffet in the morning is included.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was a strength of the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: More frequent shuttle.
review.locationRemarks: Go to and from the airport.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Our room was very clean and beds were comfortable. It's next to the SF international airport so be prepared for a bit of noise (not too bad). Only complaint is with the breakfast waitstaff. I was under the impression that breakfast was included with my stay. The waiter checking in people for breakfast was very rude when I asked him to double check my reservation. While I was wrong in believing my breakfast was included, I was polite and respectful in my request to double check my reservation. My husband and I decided to stay and did pay for breakfast (my 2 children were hungry), but we felt uncomfortable because the waiter kept walking by and grumbling at us. Check-in staff were great.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, comfortable and not too far from the wharf.

review.title: Hotel by the airport
review.reviewText: Good clean hotel but a long way from main town. Very good for an airport stop over but not if you are planning to sightsee. A 90 minute bus ride into down town. Best to eat at the hotel as only fast food outlets nearby. Excellent free shuttle service to and from the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Increase supply of tea, coffee and creamers in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Nothing in nearby vicinity except fast food outlets. Bus service into downtown goes every half hour. No obvious nearby shop or supermarket.

Too pricey for an outmoded hotel.

They skimped on pillow quality.  There is no restaurant on premises.  Staff were nice.  It was walking distance to Fishermans Wharf and even North  Beach.

Booked a stay and paid in full via Expedia.  Arrived at the hotel and they could not verify my pre-paid reservation in timely fashion.

I was exhausted, and the hotel clerk had no sense of urgency about rectifying the problem.  I did not appreciate the lack of professionalism and/or efficiency on the part of the clerk.

review.title: Hotel was so quiet, clean and very comfortable.

great hotel, beautiful, and love the restaurant downstairs

review.reviewText:
I got a Romo in the second flor. Out of the Window there were dome equipments making noise al the day.

Of course I do not recomendados tenis hotel

I was quite disappointed with my stay. Room was not clean when I arrived and the cleaning staff had to come clean the toilet at midnight when we arrived. The front desk was understaffed so any time we had a question during our stay there was a long wait in line before we could ask our question, even when it was very simple. Finally, our room key continued to not work and had to be changed several times which became quite inconvenient. They also charged me for a quarter cup of mild for my baby's bottle.
The staff were VERY accommodating. The bar and restaurant staff were super friendly. The hotel is clean and about 10 minutes or less from the car rental return.
review.positiveRemarks: Bar and restaurant staff. Front desk was great.
review.locationRemarks: Make sure the printers have toner and paper to print the boarding passes.

review.title: Good value easy access location
review.reviewText:
This was a good value for the season we choose to travel and for our purposes which were a clean and comfortable place to stay close to San Francisco and the Bay area. We booked through Expedia at CDN$213 per night. Our rate did not include breakfast but we had a choice to add hot buffet breakfast for $9 per person. The breakfast was OK for once or twice. They offered the typical egg bacon and pastry, etc. and of course some fresh fruit. So, it definitely was worth the money for breakfast otherwise, you can cross the street to McDonald which we did the one day we slept in past 10 a.m. 
The hotel is fully renovated with nice clean rooms and comfortable beds with white sheets and white cover. It was comparable to Marriott courtyard. The lobby and hallways were a bid outdated but not to the extent to bother me. The staff very helpful and check-in was fairly quick. 
The bathroom was also clean and modern but very small with a single sink and the toilet next to it. Again, it was no big deal because it was clean and the towels were nice and fresh. The AC unit was in the room and they can get noisy so we left the window open at night for fresh/cool San Fran air. Well, as fresh as it can be next to the airport. 
The location was convenient for us. It was 5 minutes from the airport, 20 minutes to downtown San Francisco, 15 minutes to the Bay Bridge if you wish to cross to the east Bay or Berkeley, and 10 minutes to Palo Alto and 2 minutes to HWY101
review.positiveRemarks: clean rooms, good value, good location
review.negativeRemarks: hallways and restaurant a bit outdated.
review.locationRemarks: location was convenient. It was 5 min. from the airport, 20 min. to downtown San Francisco, 15 min. to the Bay Bridge and 10 Min. to Palo Alto

review.title: Bar staff was pushy
review.reviewText: The lady working in the bar was very pushy about tipping. Her service was below par and she expected a 20% tip.
review.positiveRemarks: Front Desk Staff was very pleasant
review.negativeRemarks: Pool was supposed to be heated.. I think it had ice floating on the top...
review.locationRemarks: The location was great since we were going to the S. San Francisco Conference Center. Able to leave car at hotel and walk to the convention.

review.title: Close to Cow Palace
review.reviewText: We got this room through Expedia and it really helped on the price. We were there for an event at the cow palace and it was very close and easy easy to get there and back. The room was nice but the beds were hard. The hotel has a nice older San Francisco feeling about it. Small elevators and Small entry into the room. But overall a good experience and pretty quiet being right next to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Softer beds.. continental breakfast for those who don't want the $9.75 buffet breakfast. Just a muffin and some tea would do.
review.locationRemarks: close to the airport. close to the cow palace. close to San Francisco and San Bruno where the Tanforan Mall is.

review.title: Nice hotel not a fan of the breakfast
review.reviewText: We just stayed for a quick sleep after a long flight.  We found the staff were very nice and the room was clean and good.  The breakfast food was not good at all, we found it very poorly made and not up to the standards of normal best western breakfast.  Not worth the $9 for it!

review.title: True Customer Service
review.reviewText: This Hotel went above and beyond to make sure I was happy with my room. I was not satisfied with the room I checked into, it was 4th of July weekend and did not expect anything to come of my issues with the room. Not only were my concerns immediately addressed, I was given a larger room with a better view and a larger bed. I was truly amazed with the politeness and the true efforts that were made to make sure I was happy with my stay there. I will recommend this hotel to anyone who asks for a great place to stay. I thank them for first rate quality service.
review.negativeRemarks: I didn't like having to pay for parking.
review.locationRemarks: It was close to the freeway and my plans for the weekend was to go to pier 39 and see the fireworks.

review.title: Great hotel.
review.reviewText: Visually the lobby and all of the devor is very inviting. The rooms are very roomy and comfortable. The breakfast each morning is excellent. I've tried many hotels and I always come back to the Grosvenor.

review.title: Close Proximity to SFO
review.reviewText: We weren't staying in SF, just flying in and out of the airport here, so this hotel was perfect.  The lobby and lounge were lovely (fantastic water wall), staff was very friendly, even offered "bag lunch" breakfasts to go (even ready by 5am when we had to head to the airport!).  The room was comfy and I surprisingly didn't hear any noise from planes flying overhead.  I could blame this on the air conditioner which was a bit overloud and clanky, but it only ran part of the time.  Free, frequent shuttles to and from the airport were the icing on the cake. :)
review.positiveRemarks: Close proximity to airport, great staff, nice amenities
review.negativeRemarks: Air conditioner could use a check-up.  Everything else was great!
review.locationRemarks: Well, it's San Francisco - so everything, but you really stay at this hotel because of its proximity to the airport.

review.title: Close to the airport
review.reviewText: We arrived at 10:00am instead of putting our bags in storage for us they checked us into our room right away!! Wonderful service!

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: Free shuttle to airport.  Nice lobby and restaurant but the breakfast buffet was overpriced. Pool. The elevator bell was really loud. We were two doors down and could here it ding from inside our room.

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: Great place to stay when needing to fly out of SFO.  Very accommodating with shuttles. Food was good toi.

review.title: STAY AT SF
review.reviewText: Overall is good and staff is also kind to bring towels(Maybe there is short hand that night). There was a under construction at front but its not messy. Only thing is a little lack of parking lot.

review.title: How disappointing from the construction going on..
review.reviewText: We were very disappointed with this hotel...rooms not updated nor very clean...food bad and they were out of many things.  Staff unfriendly, not a great experience.
review.positiveRemarks: they provided a shuttle to the airport
review.negativeRemarks: better management and a complete overhaul

review.reviewText: The hotel was being renovated which made entering and parking a little difficult.  We would have liked expedia to let us know this prior to booking.  We had a handicapped traveler with us and the construction made it difficult to get in and out of the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to the airport
review.locationRemarks: This is a very industrial area so you will need to go into the city about 30 minutes away for things to do.

review.title: easy access to SFO airport, supportive staff.

review.negativeRemarks: free breakfaST TO ALL guest

review.title: Good hotel in renovation
review.reviewText: Rooms were clean, has a convenient shuttle going to the airport. However, the hotel is currently going through a major renovation. Front entrance and part of the lobby is closed.

review.title: Great!
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed my stay. My daughter said the bed was a little hard, but I thought they were great. Good Breakfast! Nice clean room, very comfortable. Friendly Staff. The elevator is a little old but I felt it added to the charm of the place and they're updating! :) Close to lots of restaurants and Hwy access. I would definitely recommend to my friends and will go there again. Really Great Time!
review.positiveRemarks: Most everything, the room, the staff, the food.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom was small
review.locationRemarks: ok, I really liked having a McDonalds across the street. easy freeway access, lots of restaurants to choose from. very close to SFO, makes it easy.

review.title: Nice hotel next to airport
review.reviewText: Very clean and quiet. Very close to the airport. Clean and nice breakfast.

review.title: Worth it.
review.reviewText:
All good except that we could hear th
E planes and the air system was a bit loud.

review.title: Convenience at a price
review.reviewText:
I call from airport for a courtesy van pickup. Response: "Driver is on his way, shouldn't be more than 10 minutes". 35 minutes later I and others were picked up. Traffic was not the problem.

Front desk check-in: I say:"Here in my reservation, an ID and the credit card to be used for this stay, it is different from the card used when the reservation was made". Twice in the next 2-3 minutes I was asked "is this the credit card to be used for this stay"? Listening skills need sharpening.

Once in the room I ordered from room service almost immediately. My order was taken my a very polite man and he told me it will be there in about 30 minutes. That gave me time to unpack, shave and was my face. 10 minutes later, in the middle of shaving there is a knock on the door....it's room service. After washing the shaving cream off my face and letting the delivery person enter, it is obvious that this is not my order. He leaves and returns about 15 minutes later with the correct order and I have finished shaving. The correct food is delivered this time. During my 18 years of weekly travel I normally would eat in my room, 4 night a week. I've had food delayed on more than several occasions, but this was the first time I've ever had the wrong order delivered. This was not the delivery person's mistake....he did what he was told to do and it was documented as such, on the invoice. 

The food was good, the ice tea was terrible but I slept like a baby that night....and awoke very rested.
review.negativeRemarks:
Courtesy van service.
Room service.
Front desk personnel.
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport.

review.reviewText:
The Entrance is under construction, hard to find the real entrance the hotel.  It is a side door temporally used as entrance. No clear sign about it.

My room is facing to the highway,  and window is sealed not very well, very noisy.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is good,  Parking is free.
review.negativeRemarks: Facility is too old. Need to updated.
review.locationRemarks: Go to the airport is easy.

review.title: 40 minute wait for courtesy van Then 25 minutes mo
review.reviewText:
After I got to the courtesy van line at the airport it took over an hour to get to the hotel.  
I asked fif there was water in th room they said yes.  There was No water in the room   Thay brought some
The bedstead light went off and on unpredictably.  Mostly off.  Too tired to deal with them fixing a wiring problem behind bed. 
very small dark room.  ok if lights worked
review.positiveRemarks: old feel.  But will never go back.
review.negativeRemarks: lights, water, and reasona blue timing of tranposrt to the hotel.  I watched other vans go by  3 times before mine came.  Then 2 stops before arrival

review.title: Adequate facility for an overnight stay.
review.reviewText: We have no complaints.  When remodeling is completed, hotel will be a very attractive place to stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Price...proximity to airport...shuttle service to airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Better coordination of activity with Expedia.  If you are going to do business with Expedia, then transactions have to be transparent to customer.

review.title: Under construction
review.reviewText: A little far to get to downtown San Fransisco. Would have been nice to have a shuttle to the main events like fishermans warf ect. That maybe left in the morning and returned in afternoon. We worked it out but this would have been a big plus

The staff were so pleasant that it was a pleasure staying there.  The breakfast was very good and the bus shuttle to the airport was on time and excellent.  The air conditioner/heater in our room wasn't working very well but we actually didn't need it.

Traveling several times every year. This was the first time I ever experienced that the room was not  cleaned up until
10 o'clock at night. I had to call the front desk for cleaning room.
The house keeping were so rude to say " we just came to work and knew nothing about it."  I was expecting some
sorts of apology but I was wrong.  I was simply stunning.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff's demeanor toward customers.

review.reviewText: There is a lady working at the reception that isn't helpful at all .The young man is very helpful as like all the other staff members except that lady . My experience was very bad with her .But the hotel was very clean ,quiet , excellent .
review.negativeRemarks: I have no remarks
review.locationRemarks: Good location we can easily take the bus .

review.title: Nice Hotel-Pleasant stay
review.reviewText: My experience was good.  We checked in late and checked out early in the morning (breakfast time).  Front desk staff was nice and answered any questions I had.
review.negativeRemarks: The interior decoration of the room.  It could be more up to date.

review.title: Hotel is under major construction currently!!!
review.reviewText:
I am only writing this to inform prospective overnighters of the problems they will encounter. First off,...our room was clean and decent. Somewhat updated.
However,...that's the only positive point. 
* the parking lot is filled with construction vehicles so goodluck trying to park close. 
*Construction starts early so don't plan on sleeping in past 7.
*The front entrance is completely tore up so you need to haul all your luggage from the far off distant land that you parked in.
* I should also point out that the free continental breakfast is only if you don't book through a third party travel site. (Misleading ammenities is not a good way too fill your hotel)
Did I mention it borders the freeway??

review.title: Stains on bed sheets
review.reviewText: My nephew noticed some stains on his bed sheets but slept on them anyway. He was tired and didn't tell me right away.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness

review.title: Pick Another Airport Hotel!
review.reviewText: Picked this BW Hotel because of proximity to airport. After being put on hold 3 times when calling for shuttle we were Td it would be 15 minutes. 35 minutes later it showed up. Hotel is under construction. Check in staff needed to complete a 5 minute conversation with another hotel employee before acknowledging we were standing waiting to check in. Room was adequate, although not thoroughly cleaned. No bathroom ammenities. Breakfast buffet was abissmal. Lots of other airport hotel choices. I'd pick one of them.

review.title: Not a great option, but better than I expected
review.reviewText: The room quality was so-so.  I don't think I'd go out of my way to stay here again, but it wasn't bad.  An affordable place for a business trip.
review.negativeRemarks: The exit and entrance story was confusing with the constructions and the parking lot was too crowded.

review.title: Nice for proximity to airport
review.reviewText: Very comfortable.  Will definitely stay again!  Great staff, comfortable surroundings, reasonable in price and great food.

review.title: close to airport

We have connecting fight next day so we choose the Best Western in order to have a good rest.  but the room is really small and smells. It was late as we arrived hotel so we choose to take it but we will never ever chose this hotel any more.
the hotel is open during remodeling. I extended my stay for one more night.

review.title: Good hotel for a few days
review.reviewText: Decent hotel very near SFO airport. OK breakfast. OK Internet. OK Parking.
review.negativeRemarks: Frontdesk service speed
review.locationRemarks: SFO airport, McDonalds restaurant across the street. Big shopping mall within ~1-2 miles.

review.reviewText:
Food.  The food at the restaurant was surprisingly good.  Had the Asian chicken and would order it again.  I was trying to stay on eastern time so I ate before 7 and could take advantage of the 2 for 1 offer on drinks. 
They are rennovating the front but this is a short time inconvenience.

review.title: Nice hotel close to my customer
review.reviewText: too bad the entrance was all closed up for construction, but the rear entrance access was tolerable. The staff was very nice. I ate all my evening meals at the hotel. The restaurant was very good. Food and service excellent. I would stay there again if I go back to SFO.
review.negativeRemarks: Get the main entrance construction completed and back open.

review.title: Hotel stay

Front desk Clerk was kind of snotty

Asked for a king got a full

review.title: Dated

We were surprised upon our arrival to find the front entrance closed for remodelling. Appears that the  portico was falling apart from the outside. Front desk staff were wearing reflective vests although they were friendly. Hotel lobby, elevator and lobby very dated. 

The room was clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Remodel the entire hotel. Let guests know they are booking into a hotel under renovation...
review.locationRemarks: Catch a flight from the SF International airport...

review.title: Easy access to airport.
review.reviewText: Seemed a bit pricey for what we got. Room was small with peeling paint on ceiling. Carpet needed a cleaning and bathroom could have been cleaner. Front desk staff were very helpful but service in the lounge was not very good. Best feature was easy access to the airport. The drive to the rental car return took about five minutes.
Hotel was under construction but it is old, noisy and overall unappealing.
Heater/A/C didnt work. Toilet wouldnt stop making weird sounds. Front desk man was rude. Wont be coming back.

review.title: San Francisco hotel to advoid
review.reviewText: What you receive is quite different from what is pomised
review.positiveRemarks: Just about everything from the staff, to the restaurant (or lack there of). to the noisy rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: New management
review.locationRemarks: Go to the other hotels to dine out.

review.title: Only the third room was reasonqable
review.reviewText:
Checked into the hotel and first room had water leakage. Second room I moved to had no main light and window that cannot be closed - clod and noisy. 
Staff was excellent helping to find a reasonable solution but general conditions are poor.

review.title: Not coming back.
review.reviewText: This is the third time we have stayed here, although the previous two times were about 5-8 years ago, we were disappointed to see the overall condition had gone downhill quite a bit from what we remembered.  This was also the third time we had booked through "a third party" as Expedia was called.  The first two times we booked, our room included the breakfast buffet, so we unfortunately assumed that this time would also include this amenity, but we were told it was not as we "booked through a third party".  We were given a "quiet" room at the end of the hallway, but the air conditioner was so noisy it was a good thing we brought our white noise machine along to drown out the noise from the AC.  The bathroom tiles were moldy and the room smelled musty.  Also we paid $7 per day extra parking fee and after coming back at 9 pm on Thursday, we circled the lot twice to find there were NO available parking spaces left.  The front desk informed us we could park in the "long term parking lot" and when we were met at the designated area there were also no spaces available there and we had to park long-ways blocking off two cars in the process, but were told it was long term parking so those cars weren't going anywhere.  After calculating what we were charged for our trip to San Francisco "through our third party" we feel we were short changed and overcharged for our stay here.  We will not be coming back.
review.negativeRemarks: Just read about our experience and that's a start.

review.title: Awesome Stay!
review.reviewText: One Word - Awesome! Close to SFO so thought we would hear the planes at night - no plane noise. Loved the comfortable look and feel of this hotel. Took me back to being a child with the wood and decor, felt elegant. Lot nicer than the newer, modern hotels with their steel and tiles finishes. Very clean too, even in the elevators (often over looked at most hotels). Would  stay there again in a San Fransico minute.

review.title: Very basic hotel. Average.
review.reviewText: Very basic for its price. Location is 2 -3 miles away from the airport and it offers basic breakfast. The hotel is right by the freeway and could be noisy at night.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco airport

review.title: Adequate with No Frills
review.reviewText: If you're just looking for a place to lay your head near the San Francisco Airport, this is a good spot.
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet clientele as I believe most were just looking for a place to stay while passing through...
review.negativeRemarks: N/A
review.locationRemarks: Close to the Airport

review.reviewText: The hotel was okay.  It seems they offer the less convenient rooms to Expedia customers.  My room was close to a noisy elevator.  Hard to find a parking.  But, very close to the airport. The staff were curtious.

review.title: SFO Grosvenor Stay
review.reviewText: Was exactly what I expected.  Rooms were comfortable, staff was very pleasant and so close to SFO.  Was perfect for my needs!

review.title: "Less than OK"
review.reviewText: I'm a business traveller and stay in hotels frequently. This hotel is less than OK. Very tired, and less than helpful staff. I would not stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: They need to look at every aspect- front desk staff, room service, customer service.
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport, a short taxi ride.

review.title: Close to the Airport
review.reviewText: This hotel is good if you need a hotel airport that doesn't feel like a hotel airport. The only complaint that I have about this hotel is that it tends to get very noisy between the highway, outside street and airport.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was very friendly and the maid service was very quick and efficient.
review.negativeRemarks: A local non-airport shuttle (within 5 miles of the hotel) would be great since a lot of guests are coming from the airport and don't have cars.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport and nearby mall with large department stores and movie theatre. There is a 24 IHOP in walking distance as well.

review.title: Over all nice stay, but could have been cleaner
review.reviewText: The set-up of the room was nice, the staff was excellent, and the lobby area felt comfortable and high-end.  The price I paid was unbeatable as well.  The only thing I would have improved was the cleanliness of the bed - several of the pillows were covered in dark hair (I'm blonde), so I had to set those aside and use the cleanest one.
review.positiveRemarks: The price and the over all comfort.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness, in particular of the bedding.
review.locationRemarks: There's not a ton nearby, and it was about an hour bus ride to the touristy part of San Francisco.  But it's very close to the airport!

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Everything's comfortable, unluckily several young people started knocking the next door at 3:30am, otherwise this is a very good hotel to stay before early flight.
review.locationRemarks: near airport with shuttle bus running every 30 minutes.

review.reviewText: Very scary neighborhood. Staff was dismissive...didn't really care to help with basic questions. Room window broken so had to hear freeway noise and shuttle drop off all night
Only negatives were breakfast  buffet for $9.00 was not as good as most free breakfasts at other motels and the computer for flight tickets was very difficult.
Found hair from previous guest in the beds,restaurant employees of the hotel are veryrude,we are still eating complimentary breakfast and they are allready taking the foods away.

review.title: Nice Hotel Right By San Fran Internat'l Airport
review.reviewText:
Traffic in San Francisco is insane so we decided to come into town the day before our flight and stay at a hotel near the airport.  This hotel is an older building that is nicely upgraded (granite in the bathrooms, nice linens, in room mini fridge).  We had the breakfast buffet and it was great- our kids ate free so a family of four breakfast cost $18.  Can't beat that!  My only gripe is a lack of children's programming- the only kids channels are Nickelodeon and Cartoon Network which show adult programs at night.  My kids were dying for Disney channel.  Other than that, a great place to stay!!

There are vending machines on each floor and when one stole my money the front desk happily gave us complimentary bottled water.  Very nicely handled!
review.positiveRemarks:
Nice and clean, great breakfast buffet
Nice service
review.negativeRemarks: Need Disney channel in the tv line up
review.locationRemarks: Great pizza place nearby called Cecilia's

review.title: Nice hotel close to SFO
review.reviewText: We were working in the area and stayed 3 weeks, the staff was great and the rooms comfortable.

review.title: Close to SFO, helpful staff
review.reviewText: Free internet, great bed, room rug a little shabby. Front desk went out of their way to please, free shuttle and room fridge a big plus too.
review.negativeRemarks: rugs a bit worn
review.locationRemarks: Just stayed overnight in transit.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Good location near airport. Convenient shuttle service.

review.title: Value for money
review.reviewText: Very courteous staff, clean and safe facility. Great value for money if you want stay near SFO.
It wasn't a 3 star hotel... I don't have anything else to say!

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Everything was fine at this hotel we have no real problems. Only comment would be that the carpet was a little bit musty, and a couple of the set pillows that were put on the bed were staying. The bed itself is just fine the sheets were clean and everything else was really good. One other comment, the airplane noise in our particular room on the eighth floor, it was kind of loud. But for the price of the location, I have no real complaints.

review.title: Smelly room
review.reviewText: Lobby was small, staff wasn't very friendly. Room was smelly and not that clean. Airport shuttle - not very clean, not very reliable comes only every 30 min.

review.title: Great for near SFO,

review.locationRemarks: Great for early flights out of SFO - free shuttle

review.reviewText: Time to think about tearing it down and build something fresh.
review.negativeRemarks: the front entry way! I have never stayed in a hotel that was up hill from the driveway to the lobby.People with mobility issues stay away!
review.locationRemarks: close to the airport

review.reviewText: Friendly staff, clean and nice room. Excellent for business travelers.

review.title: near airport

review.title: comfortable hotel

review.title: T'was a good stay!
review.reviewText: I love to stay here room is very cozy bed is very comfortable the arrangement of the furniture is good too! I just hope that they have microwave and good cable but other than that it's a great hotel...

review.title: Nice hotel to stay
review.reviewText:
Excellent customer service, clean and comfortable room and readily accessible by free shuttle service from the San Francisco International Airport (SFO).







excellent customer
We checked in to this hotel early and a room was ready!!! Bianca had exceptional customer service upon checkin.
review.negativeRemarks: Free Breakfast should be automatic
review.locationRemarks: good coffee shops in San Mateo, good easy freeway location

review.title: Overnight stay by SFO
review.reviewText: The room was fine and convenient to the airport. Good hotel for the price.

review.title: Basic hotel
review.reviewText: Due to limited room availability in area had to select this hotel.  Biggest issue I had was the noise from the freeway . The windows were very old which allowed for the constant traffic flow to be heard in the room. Not able to change room as they were sold out.

review.title: Easy access to airport and sfsu
review.reviewText: In town for a quick stay to visit daughter at sfsu...staff was very upbeat and helpful. Got back to hotel late each night and ordered room service each night, as there aren't too many food places that are near hotel. Dinner in room was a nice added bonus that I have not experienced at a Best Western before.
review.positiveRemarks: Reasonable pricing of room rate and very friendly staff.  Room service was reasonably priced too.
review.negativeRemarks: It is near the airport so expect to hear planes...there really is no way to improve the noise level, but just expect this if staying at this hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to airport/car rental and near enough to sfsu, it took me 15 minutes to campus by freeway.

review.title: Nice enough budget hotel, but isolated area
review.reviewText: Take the free shuttle back to the airport where you can catch the BARTH into the city, only takes 20-30 minutes
This hotel more than met my needs for my stay near SFO last night.
review.positiveRemarks: The service in the bar/restaurant was friendly and service-oriented.

review.title: Not a 3 star very deceiving
review.reviewText:
I would rate this a one star not three

Hotel staff all seemed over worked and rushed us through 
Beds were  comfy enough and that was it
Sink was obviously clogged with something and rust all around drain in sink and tub
Elevator permit was 4 months past expiration 
Elevators were sketchy (old,slow)
Coffee was NOT INCLUDED in the breakfast which was mediocre
They charged $4 for coffee and it wast great and also wouldn't make me coffee after 10
No places to eat around except mcdonalds which we got sick from 
Over all ver unpleasant and was not worth the $500 we paid for three nights that's for sure

review.title: Very comfortable beds - nice room - staff helpful
review.reviewText: Stayed two nights with cruise between stays. Really comfy room, restaurant and bar real handy & good food & selection of draft beers including Guinness! Staff really helpful, especially John at the desk. Free shuttle to/from airport. Definitely recommend.
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport but long drive or cab ride to downtown & Fisherman's wharf.

review.title: Nice hotel , near airport , car rental
review.reviewText: Nice hotel , good location , staff was not friendly , a little bit noise from airplane .

review.title: Nice hotel close to SFO airport, great kitchen
review.reviewText:
Stayed for 6 nights, quite happy. Very good hot breakfast. Tasty dinner - both sea food and beef cooked to perfection. Free WiFi. Definitely better than average Best Western. 

The only down side, shuttle runs only every 30 minutes (other hotels seem to run every 15 minutes).
review.negativeRemarks: Shuttle running every 15-20 minutes would be much better.
review.locationRemarks: Shuttle+BART would get you to downtown in one hour or so. Uber will do in 20-30 minutes depending on traffic

review.title: Rate quote discrepancy
review.reviewText: The rate Expedia quoted when the reservation was made was $380.98. The amount charged to our card by the hotel was $457.98.  The hotel said for them to verify the difference was that it needed a daily rate instead of the total rate given on the confirmation by Expedia.  Trip itinerary # 772705009271. If this is the case, we will not do business through Expedia again. It's not the amout of the difference, it's the principle.
review.positiveRemarks: The bar and bartender were nice.  The rooms were alright - but definitely too high priced for what we got.
review.locationRemarks: If you are accessing the airport, it is fine.  Otherwise, it's too far from anything else.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the airport.
review.reviewText: It filled  the bill for what I was looking for: a comfortable place to stay overnight  after arriving on a flight early in the evening.
review.positiveRemarks: It had a restaurant and pool, staff was very nice/helpful, room was very nice, email could be checked on a guest computer, and a good airport shuttle.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast buffet was OK, but selection could have been a little better.  Prime rib for dinner was good, but vegetables could have been better prepared

review.title: Could be better
review.reviewText: I had a very small room and still paid a high rate.  Cobwebs in the corners of the ceiling. Inconvenient electrical access (one outlet too lose to even hold plugs and nothing free near nightstand.  Had to request bill - not in room upon checkout.  High parking fee was annoying also.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was friendly.  Wi-fi was easy to connect and seemed stable
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness.  Bathroom can be updated (tile cracking/separating, leaky spout etc).  Better electrical access.

review.title: Nice Hotel, close to the Airport and BART.
review.reviewText: Nice Hotel that is close to SFO.  The free airport shuttle makes it easy to get to the BART station at SFO and downtown San Francisco is then about 30 minutes away.  BART costs about $8.65 each way to Embarcadero Station.  McDonald's is across the street and IHOP is about a 3 minutes walk on Airport Boulevard.  Front desk staff was quick, friendly and efficient.  Being able to print out your boarding pass is a plus.  My room room was far away from the elevator so no constant elevator bell dings.  Daily housekeeping very good.  I did not try out the Gym or the Restaurant.  I would definitely stay at this Hotel again.

review.title: Terrible stay and overcharged by Expedia!
review.reviewText: I was charged xxx.xx for a marginal room on Expedia.com and booked the room weeks before travel. A friend booked the same room from another source, two weeks before our event, for half! I questioned the hotel staff about this and was told that they could do nothing as it was a third party Expedia issue on the room rates. The rooms are small, bathroom really small and the breakfast staff was very rude and charged for a breakfast that I should've walked across the street to McDonalds and got for five bucks! Not happy with Expedia nor the Best Western Grovsenor Airport. SF travelers should avoid this hotel and look for another third party providers for booking their rooms!
review.negativeRemarks: Better staff. Expedia being up front with rates.
review.locationRemarks: Close to SFO

review.title: Ridden hard, put away wet.
review.reviewText: Old, tired furniture and decor. Terrible parking policy, paid $7.00 to park after paying $298 for a room. Had to walk back to my car after checkin to put a parking permit on my dash. There are a lot better hotels close to SFO.
I would recommend the hotel for a short stay, but I would warn visitors of the remote location.
review.positiveRemarks: The entire hotel staff was very accomodating and extremely pleasant!
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel including rooms a little outdated, but clean.
review.locationRemarks: No notable locations to visit within walking distance.

review.title: Older hotel showing its age but great staff
review.reviewText:
This is an older Hotel showing its age in terms of the decoration and fixtures in the main Hotel and the rooms.
Good bed but poor bathroom fixtures and poor fitting windows which let a lot of noise in. Air conditioning is very noisy. Cost for the area is good, cleanliness is very good and all staff were very friendly and provided a great service
review.positiveRemarks: Good bed, great staff and free WiFi
review.negativeRemarks: rooms are old and bathroom esp is in need of an update, breakfast was below average and expensive cross the road to the McDonalds.
review.locationRemarks: Good location for the airport and shopping mall close by

review.title: Great start or finish
review.reviewText:
This hotel is 1 mile from the airport and very easy to find.
The staff are friendly and helpful.
The happy hours at the bar include snacks.
The complimentary breakfast has a good variety and is of a very good standard and quality.
The rooms are spacious and well maintained. We had a fault on the aircon and a man was at the room within 5 mins of us reporting it.
Only issues were the $7 car park fee and a hum of traffic from the nearby freeway. However if you fly in internationally you are likely to be too tired to notice until the morning.
A great hotel to use on arrival or departure from town.
Not really suitable if you are sightseeing for a few days. For that you need either Fishermans Wharf or Union Sq areas.
review.negativeRemarks: See above
review.locationRemarks: See above

review.title: SF giants game
review.reviewText: Spent some time in SF w some family and went to see the ball game.

review.title: Good location.
review.reviewText: Easy to find, great access to freeway. Clean, comfortable, good layout. Restaurant was reasonably priced, but in the evening it was short staffed. Breakfast, not included in room rate, was an extra cost that I felt wasn't justified. There is an IHOP half a block north; I'd go there next time.
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean, comfortable, pleasing to the eye. Everything worked.
review.negativeRemarks: As always, the single diner could be offered a better table for dinner, other than the service hallway. Especially when there are many empty tables!
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to freeway and airport makes this a good hotel to stay for short duration. It's not close to the city, but easy to get there.

review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 1 night.  Everything was wonderful except for one thing.  Unfortunately we booked the hotel through Expedia.  When we arrived at the hotel, I informed them that we were AAA Members and requested their discount.  Unfortunately since we booked through Expedia, we were unable to receive our discount.  That was the first and last time I will use Expedia.
Overall was a decent hotel. Very close to the airport so can hear the planes taking off and the busy road nearby.

review.title: Restaurant
review.reviewText: Employee named alain who works at the restaurant cashier,is very rude likes to argued with customer .even you told him to stop he wont stop arguing. Thats why im giving this review , just for this employee it makes the hotel bad.
review.negativeRemarks: Trained employee to be professional on its customer.

review.reviewText: Room was the size of a closet.   The bed was actually against the wall with very little room on the other side and at bottom of the bed.  Hazard waiting to happen.    Breakfast was supposed to be included but was not.

review.title: A good hotel for much money
review.reviewText: A good hotel with good staff. The price was too much. It is a pity that take advantage of being at the airport. Even for the parking you had to pay as a guest staying in the hotel

review.title: Would not stay here again.
review.reviewText: First room smelled of smoke and mildew.  We were given another room and it smelled of cleaning products.  We booked through an online company that mentioned a breakfast was included.  It is not the buffet at the hotel its a brown bag breakfast that is only offered from 4-6 in the morning.  Overall I would not recommended this hotel to someone when Hampton Inn is down the block and they offer more for the same price.

review.title: Nothing to do
review.reviewText: Little bit pricey for being so far from town. Not an easy trip if you want to get anywhere. No shops nearby except tile shop and McDonald's across street. Shuttle bus is handy but is required to go back to airport to then get train into the city. Then when your done with a little sight seeing you have the train trip  back to airport then wait for courtesy bus to hotel. Adds 2-3 hrs onto your day.
review.positiveRemarks: Restaurant was friendly enough and food was good
review.negativeRemarks: Pricing
review.locationRemarks: Nothing

review.title: Clean hotel with free frequent airport shuttles.
review.reviewText:
This hotel provides free airport shuttles to and from the airport which makes it very convenient to get the the BART system to downtown San Francisco. The staff are very friendly and will provide you with the hotel shuttle schedule so that you can time your trips to downtown. The female bartender (I did not get her name) made great drinks and was very out going. You get the free breakfast only if you book directly with the hotel otherwise it's about ten bucks. There's a McDonald's across the street if you want to save the ten bucks. The airport noise from the planes was not that noticeable to me as some people have stated, must be due to room location. My room was facing the freeway.
Great hotel to stay in. No incidental charges like other hotels charge for using Wi-Fi.
review.locationRemarks: The San Francisco BART is easy to get to using the hotel Shuttle service.

review.title: Jewel of a hotel in a poor location
review.reviewText:
This was one of those deals where Expedia gave us a good rate before telling us what the hotel was. For a visit to San Francisco a hotel in South San Francisco was fine, distance wise. 

The hotel was very nice, professional staff and we had a clean and comfortable room (especially the beds).

The only downside was the location, just north of the airport. The plane noise was not bad at all, but in that location you get a lot of cold wind and fog coming over San Bruno mountain. The neighborhood is no great shakes - it's safe, but it's warehouses and other stuff not worth visiting. There's a McDonald's across the street and an IHOP a block away.

If you're a business traveler, just interested in getting to the area and seeing your client, this will suit your needs admirably. It's also a good place to meet clients -- unless you're worried about the impression the locale gives.
review.positiveRemarks: Professional staff, clean comfortable room (especially the beds). We did not try the restaurant but it looked great.
review.negativeRemarks: Well, the location -- but you can't really improve that now, can you?
review.locationRemarks: The plane noise was not bad at all, but in that location you get a lot of cold wind and fog coming over San Bruno Mountain. Nothing good nearby.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Hotel is close to airport and across the road from a bustop to city. Breakfast is nice and rooms are clean. Rooms a little on the small side but for one night and one traveller they were fine

review.title: Convenient to airport.
review.reviewText: Best part about the hotel for us was that it was close to the airport. Staff was attentive and helpful. Room wasn't anything special. I didn't feel like this was a very good value, as breakfast was not included in the room rate and there was a $7 parking fee.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was very comfortable and the sheets/comforter were very nice. I slept well even though there was a fair bit of noise from planes flying over.
review.negativeRemarks: Bed skirt and carpets soiled- could use a cleaning.

review.title: Close to SFO Airport and car rental return
review.reviewText: Close to airport rental return.  Shuttle available and hotel staff helpful in providing info for it's use and requirements

review.title: Good hotel conveniently located for the airport.
review.reviewText: Good hotel conveniently located for the airport. Breakfast was not included for us however the restaurant was very good. Able to check flight details and print off boarding passes. Regular shuttle to the airport. Car parking was $7 per night
review.locationRemarks: Just for the airport

review.title: Near the airport
review.reviewText: Front desk staff not adequate, parking is tight, circled for some time on Sat eve check in.  Pool was ok - water warm enough, even on a windy day.
review.positiveRemarks: Pool with warm water, near the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Better front desk staffing.  Not good info about options for breakfast - need to make this more clear.

review.title: Staff very friendly room clean
review.reviewText: Room clean but lamp shade had several old brown stains. Glass in room broken, however I did not need to use it... Overall great experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Room clean and trash containers had bags.   Great view from window.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing...just change lamp shades.

review.title: Excellent restaurant in hotel
review.reviewText: The chef is amazing; we had an excellent dinner in the hotel restaurant despite arriving near closing time. The Mongolian beef with asparagus was especially exquisite.
review.positiveRemarks: The restaurant and the friendly and helpful staff
review.negativeRemarks: Well, our room was right in front of the elevator and we could hear it ring every time the door opened. That kept me awake.
review.locationRemarks: I don't know

review.reviewText:
Very pleasant. Air conditioning a bit noisy but it drowns out the sounds of the over head 
Staff very pleasant

review.title: Nice hotel and in central location.
review.reviewText:
The parking that I was charged for was terrible.  I had to park on the grass and the sprinklers came on and
sprayed my car.  I drove around for 10 minutes looking for a parking spot.
review.negativeRemarks: Yes, the phone was not working in my room so I had to take my bags down by myself.

review.title: Very convenient for the international airport .
review.reviewText: Staff very helpful.Restaurant and bar available in hotel and very reasonable which is uncommon at airport hotels.Rooms small but very comfortable. Quite noisy but to be expected as people tend to be coming and going all the time.
review.positiveRemarks: Efficient well informed staff ,shuttle bus service,comfortable rooms.

review.title: Close to hotel
review.reviewText: Inexpensive place to stay. Close to airport so u can catch the BART from there. Wish it had a kitchen though.
review.locationRemarks: Location is okay, u can hear the planes cross. Mcdonalds is near if u need a burger fix.

review.title: End of our vacation
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, very friendly staff at front desk.  Was slightly wonked that the beautiful breakfast displayed on the first floor was not included in our room booking.  There was nowhere on our booking to "request" breakfast be added to the room.  We ended up leaving and eating somewhere else.  Couldn't justify $9/person for breakfast there.  Otherwise, perfect hotel for anyone flying out the next day.
review.negativeRemarks: Better communication regarding the breakfast not being included OR lower the price of the breakfast so that regular people can afford it.
review.locationRemarks: Location in relation to the airport was a deciding factor for us.

review.title: Near to airport
review.reviewText:
Good experience staff friendly                   
               Clean near to airport shuttle service

review.title: Not quite satisfied
review.reviewText:
The front desk staff are not quite up to the task.  We booked a room for two adults and one child.  We requested an upgrade to a suite and immediately changed our mind.  We stayed in one room with two beds and got a rollaway.   This obviously was too much for the front desk to handle.  It took a long time for us to check out.  The person asked why the three of us couldn't share the two beds in the room.... 

Also, on Expedia, we were told we booked a deluxe room but the hotel insisted we had a standard room.
review.negativeRemarks: I think Expedia needs to make sure the hotel and Expedia are on the same page on room types.

review.title: Good location to SFO
review.reviewText: Excellent location for SFO, punctual shuttle. Good bar and restaurant nice decor. Food was excellent, sent compliments to the chef!
review.locationRemarks: Took the BART for the airport,via shuttle and did the tourist sites.

review.title: Comfort
review.reviewText: Great room with a view so comfortable my daughter did eant to leave

review.title: Dumpy
review.reviewText: Check-in guy was courteous, but that is about all the Grosvenor had going for it. Our electronic room keys did not work twice and we had to keep returning them. The windows didn't fully close and it was a straight drop down and we were traveling with small children. The room felt and looked skanky - worn, not very clean, decorated like a bordello. No proper light - but only french-fry light on a timer- in the bathroom. Smelled like a car freshener laced over the inside of a dirty car; automatic wake-up device on the phone inoperable and no-one picked up when you called the front desk.
review.negativeRemarks: see above

review.title: Good overnight stay
review.reviewText:
We were passing through San Francisco, so only needed a simple overnight stay. Against this undemanding criteria, we were not disappointed. The hotel looks a bit tired, but so do an awful lot of US hotels, especially in New York, including quite expensive ones.
Drinks at the bar followed by a restaurant meal, were all perfectly reasonable, if not particularly distinctive. But, for a reasonable price, easy airport shuttle service, and a good sized and comfortable room, we cannot be overly critical. The one failing was a very noisy fridge (or was it the internal aircon unit, difficult to say). Whilst we were able to cope with aircraft taking off, the erratic and noisy fridge proved a disturbance.
review.negativeRemarks: First impression, the lobby, could do with refreshing.

review.title: Airport Hotel Good Place to Rest
review.reviewText: Stayed here two nights - on our arrival and before our departure.Staff was very pleasant. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Coffee available in the morning before the shuttle to the airport.

review.title: convenient to airport.
review.reviewText: It was fine for a night. I was 2 rooms from the elevators and the dings woke me up during the night. The food was good but my waiter seemed cranky. Perhaps he didn't enjoy a single diner.  However the rest of the staff was great.

review.title: Decent hotel, but keep in mind it's close to SFO
review.reviewText: Had an early morning flight, so I booked close to SFO to make travel in to the airport easier. There's nothing wrong with this hotel, but you have to remember it's location. SFO has flights coming in & out until the wee hours of the morning, and you WILL hear them quite loudly at Best Western Grosvenor.
For the money, this hotel should have been much better.  It's in need of a renovation.

review.title: Okay near by airport
review.reviewText: Vending machine was just eating money. No bevarages provided.

review.title: one night close to airport
review.reviewText: needed somewhere clean and close to airport after long flight from NZ.
review.positiveRemarks: easy to find and close to airport
review.negativeRemarks: remove parking charges, better selection of tea in room and a kettle. atmosphere and decor was dull and dingy
review.locationRemarks: IHOP next door and McDonalds. gas station close. Shopping at San Bruno Mall, good freeway access to SFO and south

review.title: Noisy close to the airport and the Freeway
review.reviewText: Good Price breakfast in the morning but the room is very Noisy

review.title: close to the airport,with shuttle bus every 30 min
review.reviewText: very basic restaurant with poor breakfast. You have to go back to the airport to catch the train to down town SF,$8.35 one way.
review.positiveRemarks: It was comfy and we were hiring a car from SF airport driving down to LA, so it was well located for our needs.
review.negativeRemarks: BREAKFAST.
review.locationRemarks: Near the airport, nothing to do , you need to catch a train to down town. Total trip time (hotel/airport/down town) apx 40 min.

review.title: Unsanitary place
review.reviewText: I don't recommend this place to anyone. This place was like a motel 6 for 5 times the price

review.title: Not so good experience
review.reviewText: We always stay at Holiday Inn but for this time, some of our company have booked earlier in this hotel so I tried this hotel. Never knew that our reservation didn't include breakfast because it's expedia. I wished the breakfast staff explained it nicely when we arrive at the area. Instead he was SO RUDE and we got embarrassed in front of our relatives. I had to tell him, " I will pay. Ok?". The eat of the staff were nice though.
review.negativeRemarks: Free breakfast, for all reservations.
review.locationRemarks: airport

review.title: Airport shuttle
review.reviewText: I picked this hotel because it provided free transportation to and from the airport. The room was fine and being next to the airport, was as noisy as I expected. The bar was open until midnight which gave us a quick opportunity for a snack after a long flight.
review.negativeRemarks: They charge $8.95 for breakfast. It should be complimentary as it was standard breakfast fare.

review.title: Convenient hotel to SFO.
review.reviewText: My wife and I stayed at this hotel at the end of a 2 month road trip which started and ended in San Francisco. The hotel is conveniently located near SFO. The facilities were very nice. The nightly rate we paid did not include complimentary breakfast but was still a good value when including the breakfast buffet for two the following morning. The only negative was the sound volume of planes taking off but that may not be a significant factor if one's room is not facing the airport. The complimentary shuttle service made dropping off the rental car the night before our flight convenient as well as taking us to the airport the following morning. I would stay there again
review.locationRemarks: Near the airport.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Parking is $7 per day, but the stuff gave it to is for no charge.

review.title: Convenient location to airport.
review.reviewText: Quite noisy. Had to wait for a TV remote that would work and coffee maker didn't work in the morning. Took some time to get a pot of coffee brought up. Easy shuttle ride to airport which we were looking for and it was free!
review.positiveRemarks: Lounge and eating area. Good dinner and breakfast menu with very pleasant workers. Very clean and staff pleasant when checking in and out.
review.negativeRemarks: Perhaps thicker window glass to reduce outside noise.
review.locationRemarks: A few miles from airport. Nothing special in surrounding area other than other hotels and McDonalds.

review.title: Close to the airport
review.reviewText: Attentive staff, clean room, comfortable bed, but overall looked worn.
review.negativeRemarks: Water conservation: Flow restrictors in shower and sign asking to put towels for laundry on floor
review.locationRemarks: Great airport shuttle service arrived right on time 5:04am for my 6:15 flight.

review.title: Conveniently Located, Room much to be desired.
review.reviewText:
The hotel staff were excellent.
I left my daughter's birthday present in the room. I can only hope they head facilities person was able to mail it to my house as promised.

The room was not in the best shape. There is rust and grime on the bathtub handles.
The bathtub floor had some dirt.
Worst of all the toilet seat would not stay up and the tank makes a water flowing sound every very minutes.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel staff were very professional and nice
review.negativeRemarks: Better maintenance of the room and especially the bathrooms
review.locationRemarks: There's a Macdonald just across the street. The hotel bar seem to have a nice community of regulars.

review.title: Great location just outside the big city...
review.reviewText: From the moment we arrived, the staff, namely Biancha and Justin, were of the utmost help and beyond courteous. The room was nice and clean, as expected. I had no issues whatsoever. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

review.title: Not your best choice
review.reviewText: Convenience shuttle bus back and forth airport. The bus driver is friendly. But the room space is small. It looks clean but I got several bug bites on my leg when I stay there.

review.title: Exceptionally friendly staff
review.reviewText: I stayed for two nights and enjoyed my stay. Hotel staff was very friendly and the room was in tip-top shape. There was also complementary snacks in the morning of our departure. I would certainly stay here again.

review.title: Good hotel close to airport
