review.reviewText: I only spent one night in transit to another flight which would take me abroad. I had no idea there was a shuttle service between airport-hotel because nothing was mentioned when the reservation was made.
review.negativeRemarks: quality of breakfast
review.locationRemarks: I didn't do anything.

review.title: free shuttle to bart
review.reviewText: it's an all right stay if you just want free shuttle to the airport and SF downtown

review.title: Good staff
review.reviewText: Friendly staff. Close to airport. Clean room and bathroom. Happy with my stay.

review.title: Nice and close to the airport. Very comfortable
review.reviewText:
The beds are super comfortable!

I was promised a breakfast in a bag to take to the airport with me.
None! And there was no time to wait for one to be made. Other than that it's a great hotel!

review.title: Unexpected location; disappointing desk staff
review.reviewText:
Clearly the picture on the website did NOT do the hotel justice; the ambiance, the classiness, and the total vibe of the hotel was very cool and very nice.

At first, the desk staff was friendly and helpful. On Sunday, seemed to take forever to get someone to answer the phone to answer my question of when check-out time was. Later that Sunday night, I tried and I tried to get the hotel because I wanted to say THANK YOU but I was put on hold twice and no one answered my call; did get to say thank you a day or two later.

Overall, as implied above, I did have a good time, as well as my friend who accompanied me--she had no problem parking the car during the night which she appreciated--and we both enjoyed ourselves.
review.negativeRemarks: Absolutely assisting guests; even if there are 400 people in the lobby wanting rooms, each of us deserves and has earned the right to personal service
review.locationRemarks: Did not have time or truly interest to see what was nearby; primarily our visit was to sleep and to take some time to relax.

review.title: Overnight before flight out of SFO
review.reviewText:
Very nice desk person. Outdoor pool. TINY , TINY room.
Shuttle to airport on time and easy.

review.title: Great hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText: Excellent customer service, shuttle service was perfect, room was very clean.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to the airport, free shuttle, free breakfast, free parking, SO SIMPLE!
review.negativeRemarks: Windows are not sound proof at all, very noisy even from the 8th floor.
review.locationRemarks: It's a great hotel when you arrive or leave by plane. Other than that, do not go there because it is noisy!

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel near the airport for one night. Staff was nice and helpful

review.title: Worst hotel I have stayed at in 20 years.
review.reviewText: I was guaranteed a king size bed. I get to the room, --- it has two double beds. I call the frond desk, it took 5-6 minutes for the desk to answer. They checked and said they found a king size bed. They tell me I have to come down to the front desk and pick up the key because they have no bellmen. It's close to midnight, I'm beat but I go down to the front desk. I change keys and go to the new room. I get ready for bed and turn on the air conditioner before getting under the covers. The air conditioner is really loud and makes a strange noise. I turn the TV on, but can't hear anything because the air conditioner is so loud. I try to turn up the TV, but the TV will not get louder than about half volume. I think it is blocked somehow from turning the TV up loud. I turned the TV off, but the air conditioner is so loud I can't fall asleep. The air conditioner shut off when the room reached the programed temperature and I fall asleep immediately. A few minutes later it turns itself on and wakes me up. This went on all night long. I would fall asleep when the air conditioner went off, but be awake when it came on. I was too tired to pack up everything and go down to the front desk. It was my hell stay!
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms!

review.reviewText: I've stayed at other best western hotels that were nicer, so I expected the same quality
review.negativeRemarks: Update the entire hotel. It's very dated

review.title: Convenient to airport
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice. Room was clean. Our first night at the hotel there was no parking at the hotel. We drove around the parking lot for over 30 minutes. During this time we talked with the gentleman at the desk several times, I have no problem saying he was rude and no attentive. The next evening we took our rental car back to the agency as we were concerned about the parking issue. Justin at the front desk was extremely helpful, refunding our parking charges, and apologized for the issues we had the previous evening. Justin saved our stay.
review.negativeRemarks: They really need to take care of those who are lodging at their hotel, making sure there is room for them to park a car. This spoiled our evening.

review.title: Pleasant staff
review.reviewText: Pleasant staff went for baseball game and employee, also from Cleveland, was genuinely friendly and welcoming. Room was comfortable and near the Cal Train station. Only criticism was breakfast buffet had little hot items and French toast was barely edible.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was really nice and the rooms was super clean and the beds were the best the bed cover was so comfortable that I actually bought one online...
review.locationRemarks: There are things close by but very easy to get to and from San Francisco, without the high price hotel rates and parking rates.

review.title: Im glad they had a free shuttle to the airport.
review.reviewText: The room was very nice and happy for the upgrade to a larger room. But if im spending that much money on a hotel I at least want a continental breakfast in the morning.
review.positiveRemarks: How close it was to the airport

review.reviewText: It was over priced and the building is in need of repair ... the hotel staff was put out to have to wait on you and it was generally a very negative experience ... sort of like visiting the dump ... or living in the trash can.
Great value, delivered what was advertised. Shuttle from airport was a bit slow, shuttle to airport was excellent.

review.title: Only reason not a 5 is wasn't crazy elaborate.
review.reviewText: Beds very comfortable, A/c worked well, nice check in, clean,

review.title: Great Airport Hotel
review.reviewText: Just stayed the one night before flying home. A nice clean hotel. Good shuttle service to airport.

review.title: Convenient with shuttle to airport
review.reviewText: Hotel staff brought more towels when I called and when I couldn't get the coffee pot to work at 4 am, staff immediately brought me a replacement. Also liked that they offered a "to go" brown bag breakfast because we departed before they served their mini breakfast at 6 am. Loved that I could print my boarding passes at the hotel, also.

review.title: One positive - very close to airport
review.reviewText: Not sure if I had more noise from the 101 or the runways but super noisy. Bathroom was freezing and the heating didn't work there. Shortened my stay from 2 nights to 1 and moved to a different hotel.

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: We stayed here because it was close to the airport and were pleased with the decision. The shuttle was easy to and from the airport, but we did not get any airport noise while in our room. The rooms were clean and updated. The breakfast buffet was very reasonable and included a good variety of drinks as well as hot and cold food choices. Overall a pleasing experience for a reasonable price in San Francisco!
review.negativeRemarks: Light switch in bathroom hard to find. It's tiny and on an outlet.
review.locationRemarks: Great access to airport. Only took us about 20 min to get to Fishermans wharf and all of the touristy things to do there.

review.title: closed airport and beach
review.reviewText: I found out that room rate is higher on Monday -Thursday than Friday to Sunday usually.

review.title: Comfy and affordable
review.reviewText: Comfortable beds, great location, but very loud. Fine for a one night stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice beds. Free shuttle to airport was a bonus.
review.negativeRemarks: WAY too loud. Walls seemed paper thin.
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport.

review.title: Close to airport with free shuttle service
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel because it was the cheapest of the bigger chain hotels and close to the airport. Room was nice for a one night stay. Simple and clean, no frills.

review.title: BUG BITES!
review.reviewText: Woke up in the middle of the night with a line of itching welts down one arm. My wife had a few as well in the morning. Didn't see or find the culprit(s) but they look just like bedbug bites and are still itching more than a day later. I now get to decontaminate my luggage and clothing instead of unpacking. Never going back.

review.title: Good hotel for overnight stay near airport
review.reviewText: We were looking for a hotel close to the airport for an overnight stay and had a good stay at BW. The breakfast was included and it was very good selection, including hot items. We would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Pleasantly surprised
review.reviewText: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. I stayed 3 nights. The rooms are a bit dated but the bed was very comfortable, and there were different sized pillows to choose from. I'm a stomach sleeper so I prefer thinner pillows. I slept very well during my stay. The staff was pleasant, and accommodating but sometimes short staffed when the shuttle bus dropped off. I waited about 20 min to check-in. The hotel is sandwiched between a major highway and a busy street, so I requested a higher floor, which worked out fine. I didnt had any noise issues at night, but during the day there is definitely traffic noise. The hotel is right next to the airport and also next to the highwat to SF so location was fine. I would recommend this hotel if you're out and about during the day time

review.title: CLEAN AND EFFICIENT STAY
review.reviewText: Easy parking, fast checkin, and fun little bar/big screen tv.
review.negativeRemarks: My only suggestion would be to have coffee available in lobby thru 9am . Room coffee with powdered cream just does not do it.

review.title: close to the airport
review.reviewText: The choice to stay at the hotel was based on it's location to the airporrt.
review.negativeRemarks: it's old and could be updated
review.locationRemarks: within 5 minutes from SFO airport

review.title: Nice trip
review.reviewText: My friends and I spent 4 days in this hotel. The front is nice, and the room is clean. Not old, location is very convenient, if you drive, you can go the highway easily.

review.title: convenient to the airport
review.reviewText: nice hotel. glad to have shuttle service to and from the airport. the food in the restaurant could be better.
review.negativeRemarks: offer a la carte breakfast.

review.title: Rating of Best Western Plus Grosvenor Airport Hote
review.reviewText: This Hotel was below our expectations in every category

review.title: Good for Airport
review.reviewText: This was a stopover due to early flight next morning, we arrived late and were booked in quickly, there were 50 school kids in the lobby and the staff made sure I was on a different floor, although they were no trouble and made little noise. The bar was open late and the hot food was available up to 10 pm.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were very helpful and accommodating, food was available late and of a good quality.

review.title: Best location for the price
review.reviewText: Our request was given without additional price. I just do not like that the customer has to pay to park his car.

review.title: Marihuana through out hallway
review.reviewText: Room is ok, bad sound proof. Extremely noisy and can hear people's conversation in hallway. Booked non smoking room. Strong marijuana smoke and smell when I was walking to my room. Neighbor was also smoking, because scent went through the locked interior door. Another negative, charge $7 for hotel guest?!? Not right! Front desk greet without smile, just a come and go attitude.

review.title: Too close to Airport and High Way - NOISY
review.reviewText: Too close to Airport and High Way - NOISY. The overall price is overrated including the restaurant prices. The parking charge ($7 per night) should have been notified before signing in.
review.negativeRemarks: The overall price is overrated including the restaurant prices. The parking charge ($7 per night)should be waived or notified before signing in.
review.locationRemarks: Too close to Airport and High Way - NOISY and nothing to do.

review.title: Close to airport. Friendly staff. Needs updating
review.reviewText: Service to airport was easy. Quick check in. Noise was moderate

review.title: Close to airport. Friendly staff. Needs updating
review.reviewText: Service to airport was easy. Quick check in. Noise was moderate

review.title: Would stay again
review.reviewText: convenient location to the SFO. Clean room, friendly staff, decent price.

review.title: Meh. For sleeping only.
review.reviewText: Hotel staff were professional and responsive. Room was small but reasonable. Fridge was broken - the door seal did not work at all - so keeping anything cold wasn't possible. Bathroom was bizarre - when was the last time you saw a cast-iron 1950s-style built-in tub in a hotel? Bathroom was reasonably clean, but full of cracking/stained surfaces and mismatched materials. Ceiling had visible damage from what was likely a water leak on the next floor. Room is very noisy when planes go over, but since the fridge door wouldn't close it ran constantly, which created useful white noise to help me sleep. Bed was lumpy but no more so than my broke-down home mattress. In other words, if you just want a place to crash, this will work.
review.negativeRemarks: Resurface materials in bathroom - the cracks and stains really give the impression of water damage.

review.title: Hotel not "new" but my room recently remodeled
review.reviewText: Hotel was in a good airport location and reasonable in price. Food was good for a hotel and not very expensive. My room was recently remodeled and very clean and comfortable. Front Desk staff helpful and pleasant.

review.title: Clearly dated, great night sleep nearby airport
review.reviewText: We really got off on the wrong foot when we were told that the shuttle would be by in 10 minutes and showed up after 22 minutes. Then as is customary my husband was climbing into the bus with our one carry-on suitcase, only to literally be shoved back by driver, causing my husband to step on my foot. How is anyone supposed to know that the luggage goes in the back of the bus, and not inside as is typical with these busses? A suggestion would be to have a laminated sign on the door or window stating that the luggage goes in back and not inside. We saw the driver being rude to everyone as they too attempted to climb on bus with their luggage. Once at hotel I felt like a snack and in restaurant ordered the veggie wraps. When this arrived it had been deep fried. I choose to not eat anything deep fried and this fact isn't stated on the menu. Convenience made us opt for the breakfast in the morning. Being a vegan I asked for Soy milk - I was rudely informed that this wasn't available, by an employee who clearly couldn't hold his body up by himself, as he was lying on his one elbow on the desk the entire time. After just returning from Australia and New Zealand where Soy milk was provided at every single meal, (without having to request it) this was a great disappointment. Any time I enter a hotel the first thing I look at is the bathroom floor - it had hair on it. Also the corners between the walls and floor carpeting are in dire need of a thorough cleaning.
review.positiveRemarks: The beds were excellent and I was happy to see the removable, zippered cover on the pillows.
review.negativeRemarks: Shuttle bus - sign stating that luggage goes in back. Menu - being precise on what and how food will be prepared. Cleanliness of carpets in rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Great location nearby airport. Not noisy at all.

review.title: Convenient for the airport
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Quiet and comfortable. Would have liked more restaurants nearby

review.title: Great hotel near the airport
review.reviewText: Wonderful stay, will stay here again. Staff were nice and arranged cabs for us whenever we needed one. Can't beat free airport shuttle and free wifi.

review.title: In and out in hours
review.reviewText: but it was close to the airport and easy. I did have to pay for parking which I wasn't prepared for. There is a restaurant but I didn't eat there. Internet was easy, no password so you just selected the wifi and were done with it. Plugs were in easy reach.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: We had a great Valentines dinner in the restaurant!

review.title: Best hotel
review.reviewText: It was the best hotel we stayed in while in San Francisco!
review.positiveRemarks: We loved the restaurant and the people.
review.negativeRemarks: More waiters and waitresses.
review.locationRemarks: It was near the airport and was easy to get to all forms of entertainment!

review.title: Conveniently located near the airport
review.reviewText: The benefit to this hotel is that it was located very close to the airport, however, this isn't the kind of place you want to stay in for longer than a night. warning- breakfast is included but only if you book through best western and not through expedia.
review.negativeRemarks: amenities and breakfast

review.title: Close to the airport .
review.reviewText: The bathroom is very old , cracking all over the places, the water isn't even hot, I can't even take a shower with the warm water.

review.title: ATM issues/Cont/Breakfast
review.reviewText: Staff was very nice. The ATM never worked at night or in the am and it was suggested for us to walk down to the Valero (mind you at night which we did not do). When booking, didn't realize that the Continental breakfast wasn't included which is fine, but almost 10 dollars when tax was included was a little over the top for what you get in any continental breakfast. The bed is kind of hard, but that's a personal preference. Would still stay here again, just may do things a little differently.
review.negativeRemarks: Lower the cost of the continental breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Was close to the Conference Center.

review.title: Close to SFO but noisy and old
review.reviewText: The hotel is surprisingly noisy - only single-pane windows with leaks around the edges and next to 101 so it certainly prepares you to the sound levels on an airplane. It is only topped by the old heating/AC that sounds like a jetliner starting - every 5 minutes. The shower barely drips so the only way to take a bath is to turn in on, go have a dinner and come back with the tub half filled in the meantime. If you don't mind those issues then it's a convenient hotel - the shuttle gets you to the airport in less than 30mins and it's generally clean.

review.title: Best Western Grosvenor So SF
review.reviewText: No coffee in lobby after restaurant closes in the am.

review.title: Great hotel convienent to SFO!
review.reviewText: Great experience! Convienent to SFO! Last minute find, great price, could not have been better!

review.title: Close to SFO
review.reviewText: It's close to the airport, but has nothing really good about the place that makes it really welcoming. I found the staff to be slightly rude if anything, and the shuttle bus drivers were worse.

review.title: Close to SFO
review.reviewText: Good for a 1 night stop over, any more than that and you'll be disappointed as it lacks atmosphere. Room was not cleaned properly from previous occupant(s).

review.title: Great airport hotel
review.reviewText:
Just minutes to the airport~ that was important when you have to check in at 5am to fly home!
Clean and pleasant place to stay.

review.title: Nice hotel but very noisy since in the airport
Good place to stay
review.reviewText: Hardly any complaints.. Bianca was extremely nice. Only complaint was low water pressure in the shower. But overall, pleasant.

review.title: Shabby even for a 3 star hotel.
review.reviewText:
We needed a hotel for an overnight stay to catch an early flight from the SFO airport. I don't expect many amenities for a 3 star hotel, but I at least expect the hotel to have an acceptable appearance. The first clue of less than standard conditions was the automatic folding doors at the hotel entry. One would close properly while the other one would not fully close. In our room, the gauzy filter curtain had a 6" very ragged rip & the room's upholstered chair was ripped on the arm. We needed to seek emergency medical treatment during our overnight stay & the front desk did not know the closest emergency center. We were "directed" to a local medical clinic, but the front desk person didn't know the name of the clinic, or the name of the street it was on even though it was only 2 blocks away (which was closed anyway). Thank goodness we had some friends that lived in town & gave us the name of a 24 hour medical facility.

Except for the items discussed above, the room itself was clean. Be prepared for very thick pillows. If your stay is short in duration, the facility may be acceptable, but for a longer duration stay, don't expect too much.
review.positiveRemarks: Close the SFO airport & free WiFi.
review.negativeRemarks: Repair broken/shabby items for a more appealing appearance.

review.title: Girl Interrupted.
review.reviewText: The walls are so thin, you can hear everything. I woke up to my neighbor's conversation that lasted all morning. The mattresses were worn out and very uncomfortable.

review.title: One night stay after arriving rather late at airpo
review.reviewText: It was ok. Place is in industrial area so nothing of interest in the area.
review.negativeRemarks: Switch off some of the tv's in the bar area. I mean how much tv does it need?
review.locationRemarks: Nothing nearby unless you want mcdonalds

review.title: not bad but far away from downtown
review.reviewText: I stayed in this hotel one week for a business trip, hotel itself is pretty clean but room is quite small (well, it's San Francisco). It's close to airport, hotel provides shuttle to airport, you can take BART about 1 hour to downtown. Round trip to downtown was about $16 (Sept 2013). I won't recommend this hotel if you need to go to downtown everyday. This hotel is also pricy, about $189 per night during my stay, no breakfast if you book through Expedia. Room and hotel overall is clean, no major issue. I did notice some noise from highway but not deal breaker.

review.title: close to airport
review.reviewText: Everything was great-room, food, front desk, bed. The next morning we left our room at 11.15 am and the maid saw us leave our room and even commented on our leaving. The appropriate sign was on the door for cleaning. We came back that night between 7-8.00 pm. The room was as we left it. We were told we had left our room too late for her to clean it. It was still A.M. We called front desk and they sent towels and coffee.
review.positiveRemarks: convenient and the restaurant food was actually very good.
review.negativeRemarks: Maid service
review.locationRemarks: close to airport

review.reviewText: Very convenient location near airport. Hotel was nice, but restaurant not that good. Parking was difficult at best, They had a shuttle service to the airport which was very helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Shuttle to airport, room was nice and price point was very fair.
review.negativeRemarks: PARKING

review.reviewText: Victor welcomed us at the desk upon our arrival, a very pleasant,engaging young man!
review.positiveRemarks: Close to airport, handy shuttle. Wonderful free breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: We were there just the one night.

review.title: Great Hotel close to SFO
review.reviewText: We stayed with our family of 5 over night before our flight. The staff was very helpful, and the shuttle to SFO leaves every 1/2 hour. Room was clean and had a large flat screen TV, refrigerator, nice furniture set up, and they put a crib in the room for our baby. McDonalds across the street we grabbed sundaes before bed and a quick breakfast in the morning. Hotel is older, but it maintained cleanliness and a certain charm.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel and service I liked the shuttle bus to and from the game very convenient would most definitely go back.

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText:
My husband and I had stayed at this hotel a couple years ago and had a great time so we decided to stay here again. The couple things I wasn't impressed with is they now charge $7 a day for parking and they no longer offer continental breakfast. You have to pay $8.95 a person per day to eat breakfast. Thankfully there is a McDonalds right across the street to have a cheaper breakfast.

We went to San Fran to attend a 49ers game and the hotel does offer a bus service to the game. You pay $20 per person and they will bus you to the game an hour and half before it starts. It's convenient and better than dealing with the parking yourself.
review.positiveRemarks: We like the shuttle service and how close it is to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: The ceiling in our room was a little dirty and could have been updated.
review.locationRemarks: We had a rental car so we drove all over the place. To downtown San Francisco is only about a 15 min drive.

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: Good Good Good

review.title: Very near airport
review.reviewText:
Excellent
I was very impressed that Victor (I think) remembered my name.

review.title: Very convenient to SFO airport, easy off and on to
review.reviewText:
First desk clerk was NOT personable at all, rest of staff were very nice and helpful.

Was disappointed that we had to pay extra to park at the hotel.

A continental breakfast is offered at time of reservation, however they don't mention that the time is 4:00 a.m. to 6:00 a.m., was not happy to hear that. However, they do offer a $10 breakfast buffet, which is nice and is better than going else where at a higher cost.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient to the airport and travels on the highway.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel stay itself was very nice. Improvement would be to eliminate the parking cost and make the continental breakfast at reasonable times, like

review.title: Not a "keeper"
review.reviewText:
We were not pleased with our experience here. The restaurant was very expensive and the bar menu very limited. Bar service was extremely slow. We had a problem with our sink running very slowly, and after calling the desk and no response for 3 hours, we had to go to the desk to make a second request. The last morning there, the flushing mechanism broke on our toilet, so we couldn't flush it.
We have no intentions of ever returning here and were very disappointed.

We had a corner room on the 3rd floor and we could hear every noise and all the conversations.
Most distracting when all we wanted was sleep.
we could hear the road noise as well.
review.positiveRemarks: The receptionist was excellent in getting us in early and finding us a limosine for the day
review.negativeRemarks: Peace and quiet
review.locationRemarks: Didn't stay long enough to find out

review.title: Good for overnight stay and quick transit to airpo
review.reviewText: The hotel is a little run down, and doesn't look like that shown in the photos. The bed was very comfortable though and the hotel offers free wifi. The best part is the proximity to the airport. A functional option for an overnight stay especially with an early flight.

review.title: Very nice!
review.reviewText: No problems - everything went quite well.
review.locationRemarks: Close to SF - shuttle to airport gets you to BART which is very convenient.

review.title: Okay
review.reviewText: The beds were good, however the cleanliness of the room was an issue. Especially the unwanted hair in the bathtub. I also stayed at a Staybridge which was much cleaner and their price included a breakfast which was superior to yours.

review.title: Close to airport. But need to pay for the park.
review.reviewText: Free internet and paid breakfast. Good rate for expedia .

review.title: Not Worth The money
review.reviewText: Was Not Worth The Money Spent. No Breakfast And Other Comparable Hotels In The Area For Cheaper. Would Not Stay Here Again.

review.title: Unsatisfactory experience
review.reviewText: From the other reviews I noted that the hotel was simply comfortable and clean, which is what I wanted on my trip. Unfortunately, when we arrived in our room it didn't seem to have been properly cleaned. There was a contained of yogurt in the fridge, peanuts on the floor, hair in the bathroom and bathtub and the shampoos looked to have been used. The hotel is also much older than the photos make it look, which was also a bit disappointing.

review.title: Seeing family.
review.reviewText: Enjoyed the stay. Whenever I go to the City, I stay one night in a hotel to get an early start to see the City before I travel across the bay to see my family. I have my "must see" things before I see my family. I lived in Austin for over 25 years and I will always be a San Franciscan.
review.negativeRemarks: Did not like the bathroom light. The shower needs a rack or handle to hold on to.
review.locationRemarks: Great way to see the best city in the world.

review.title: Decent option near SFO
review.reviewText: It did the job - close to SFO for an early AM flight. Staff was fine, place was mostly clean. Typical for a BW.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location, close to SFO - but wouldn't stay here if you have business in the City - no reason to be all the way down in SSF.
review.negativeRemarks: Doors slam all night and the lighting in the bathroom is really hokey - had to use a funky timer switch that also ran the fan.
review.locationRemarks: Just stayed here for an early flight from SFO, so didn't do anything nearby.

review.title: Compared to motels like travelodge....
review.reviewText:
It's top notch in terms of aesthetics.

It looks clean. Looks is the keyword. found hair in the bed. The room I was in had it's rugs just cleaned. The bed is very hard.

I relocated to another room and thank goodness there was another bed....the first bed still had a napkin in it as if the maids came in and just tucked the sheets in very nice.

The office chair had some white protein stain all over the seat.

The grout in the bathroom was as good as a Travelodge-cheap motel-Like the inexperienced maid also had a hand at it.

And for the amount I paid I should have spent a little more for an upscale hotel. Spent about $150. $50 more and you'd be at a much nicer hotel.

Definitely nicer than a travelodge, but it only looks nicer.

review.title: Great spot, great restaurant, close to everything
Convenient
review.reviewText: I chose to stay in this hotel because I had an early flight out of SFO in the morning. the room was clean the hotel staff was friendly I did not eat in the restaurant instead I chose to go into town and have dinner. the next morning I went to SFO the rental car return was right down the block and it was really a breeze.

review.title: Airport shuttle
review.reviewText: Return shuttle back to the hotel from airport took more than a hour.
review.negativeRemarks: If your parking your car for the airport, getting back to the hotel may take long.
review.locationRemarks: See's Candy across the street.

review.title: Close to the airport and San Bruno BART
review.reviewText: The front desk people aren't that great and sometimes rude. Close to the airport and San Bruno BART (around 10-12 dollars by taxi). Not many eating options around, excepting the hotel's dining place and a McDonald's right opposite. There's free airport shuttle, so that's a plus if you are not in a hurry. No check-in restrictions, so you can do a late check-in, and early too if the house-keeping guys have done their job by the time you are there.

review.title: Good and Nice comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: My experience was good. We didnt encounter any problem like MAJOR problem. Staff were attentive and friendly. Hotel was clean and good. The only thing I would say that I did not like is the bath tub. It gets clogged easily even the stopper was unplugged. The water drains so slow. Thats the only thing I found that was not to my satisfaction. But overall I think I would book and stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom, bathtub and maybe the walls
review.locationRemarks: candlestick park, 20 mins from SF downtown (with no traffic)

review.title: Great for a weekend in SF
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, close to SF, but just far enough outside to be reasonably priced.
review.positiveRemarks: Really comfortable beds and great air conditioning.
review.locationRemarks: McDonald's right across the street!

review.title: well done... just understaffed in bar and kicthen.
review.reviewText: 5 min to sfo and timely free shuttle with nice driver. typical brekfst buffet, nothin outstand but good quality. nice bar w big screen and food was fine for place like this. worth the money when you include shuttle and in house bar/rest.
review.positiveRemarks: close to sfo and good shuttle plus full bar.
review.negativeRemarks: the staff is doing too many jobs and diners wait for a waiter so it gets discouraging afteer a long day traveling. the employees are nice tho.
review.locationRemarks: sfo. was going to a wedding in wine country but wanted to relax before driving up. great spot to do it as it is right off the freeway.

review.title: nice hotel close to airport
review.reviewText: rate was fair, room was nice, flat screen tv, nice bar and resturant

review.title: Good stopover for airport
review.reviewText: This was a pleasant hotel for our one-night stay before flying off to Boston

review.title: Nice hotel conveniently located.
review.reviewText: We found the staff to be very helpful and the hotel to be clean and comfortable. The location was excellent for access to the airport and the car rental facility. Of real importance to us was the excellent, timely shuttle service to and from the airport.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport and car rental facility

review.title: I was pleasantly surprised!
review.reviewText: Great staff, clean, affordable. The staff was very friendly and willing to help in every way possible.

review.title: Nice Hotel, close to airport.
review.reviewText: Stayed there for a week. Room was a little small but it was very comfortable. It had all the necessary things that is needed in a room. It also has an in-house restaurant for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Tried dinner couple of times and the food was amazing. There is also a bar area which has wall-size TV which was great.
review.positiveRemarks: very comfy. Good bedding, furntitures and bathroom fixtures.
review.negativeRemarks: Room size was small.
review.locationRemarks: There is a Mcdonald's just right across the street. Also an IHOP nearby. The hotel also offers restaurant. It is less than 5 miles from Airport.

review.title: Close to the airport
review.reviewText: This will be my last stay at this hotel. Parking and breakfast are not complimentary. The breakfast was terrible, biscuits were stale and hard. It looked like they were saved from a previous day. The yogurt cups were past expiration date.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to the rental car return and airport. Convenient access from the freeway.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast, if they're making us pay for it, it should be better.

review.title: It was a good experience.
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The room I stayed in was better than I expected. The bed and the shower were the awesome.

review.title: Ill keep coming back
review.reviewText: I've been there before and ill keep coming back it's basic for a quick getaway.
review.positiveRemarks: I like that its near freeway and that it's a clean place to stay also that they offer breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: If I could I would impoves thier fitness center the one they have now is kind of small.
review.locationRemarks: Great place right on the freeway, near San Francisco the ballpark and more.

review.title: Close and convenient
review.reviewText: We wanted to stay near the airport after arriving in the evening. The hotel met our purpose and we were collected by the free shuttle after only a short wait. The room was clean and the beds comfortable. The staff were very helpful in answering our questions about getting into the city centre. No room service but we didn't need it. Good value for the cost.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was great and staff helpful
review.negativeRemarks: It is dated but the price reflects that so expect it. Most important it is clean and comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport. Just across the road from a bus stop taking you to Union Square. The local bus was intersting to see an off the track part of city

review.title: Great hotel at a very reasonable price
review.reviewText: Great service with compliment breakfast. We come in late to SFO, but have no problem checking into the hotel.

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: Hotel is very convenient from the gas station food and right off the freeway. I would defiantly recommend it to my family and friends.
review.negativeRemarks: There is no need for improvement
review.locationRemarks: Gas station close and restaurants and just off the freeway so it was convenient

review.title: Close to Airport
review.reviewText: Very good experience. I was hesitant after having read some of the reviews. I took my chances by making a blind reservations using the star rating. I was pleasantly surprised. The staff was great and accommodations were not disappointing.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleaner windows
review.locationRemarks: Nothing much here. Definitely an airport commuter hotel but close to the city and many attractions by car.

review.title: Waiting airport shuttle for long time.
review.reviewText: I waiting hotel shuttle for a long time at airport. I was very angry with that. However when i got hotel, I found the standard queen room is a very big suit room. It surprise me a lot and there are two big HDTVs in two room it's so so cool. So I just forgive them for letting me waiting for so long.

review.title: Girl's weekend
review.reviewText: My room seemed small but the bed were extremely comfortable. It was perfect for one person. On my return I wanted to book the hotel again but they were sold out.
review.locationRemarks: I don't have any idea because I caught a shuttle in arriving at 10:30 p.m. and was out of the hotel by 5 a.m.

review.title: Clean and convenient to airport
review.reviewText: Our arrival and check-in were made extremely easy. The young man checking us in was efficient and knowledgeable . H e was helpful in suggesting a place for dinner which was excellent. Check out was equally easy.

review.title: Mostly disappointing stay
review.reviewText: I'd read the reviews and most stated their stay to be positive but I found mine to be otherwise. The room had a very tired, and murky feel to it. I'd wanted to leave immediately after stepping in. There was not enough light, and since I stayed in a corner room, there was only one small window. The air conditioner was very loud and I had a hard time falling asleep at night. My room also connected to the room next to it, so I constantly heard the people next door fumble with the lock. Front desk is always very busy, and the staff not entirely friendly. I was very disappointed with my stay, and will not be returning to this location again.
review.locationRemarks: You definitely need a car to get around and to get food.

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: Great breakfast but changed our room without asking us. Into a smaller room.

review.title: Very Noisy and Very stingy
review.reviewText: I was in Room 407. The highway noise was terrible. I was unable to sleep all night. Further, there were four cups for coffee in the room, but only two coffee pouches. Air conditioning was terrible. It was hot and humid inside the room.The reception desk was more interested in rattling off prices, rather than giving a welcome. I will not stay there again, definitely. The airport shuttle was ten minutes late and because the hotel shares its shuttle with three other hotels, it was crowded. There were at least ten people standing and no room for luggage.
review.positiveRemarks: The dinner at the Brass Elephant was delicious but expensive.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel could try and not be penny wise. The staff needs hospitality training.
review.locationRemarks: I was flying out of SFO and it was conveniently located.

review.title: Very good hotel
review.reviewText: Very good San Francisco area hotel. Rooms are comfortable although the bathroom is small. Very good service and the real deal is the breakfast buffet - undeniably the best one of any hotel I've stayed in; choice of fruit, yogurt, scrambled eggs, sides, toast, etc. great selection and very fresh.
review.negativeRemarks: small bathroom
review.locationRemarks: situated in the San Fran airport area, 15 minutes from Downtown

review.title: One night stay
review.reviewText: the man at the desk was very nice. We felt safe. Nice room. Thought the beds were very clean, but the mattress was a little hard for me.
review.positiveRemarks: Located very close the the airport. Shuttle service is prompt and every half hour, as advertised. Room is clean and they have a very nice restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: Could have used a microwave

review.title: Very convinient , close to airport..
review.reviewText:
Hotel provided free shuttle to airport to get subway station was very helpful.. Didnt have to rent car...
My family enjoyed it too.. Got to see more of San Fransisco...
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was very helpful with anything we needed..
review.negativeRemarks: Our stay didnt include breakfast..
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport and subway too..

review.title: Surprisingly Delightful!
review.reviewText: We stayed in this hotel on our road trip and it was surprisingly delightful! The picture makes it look a little drab, but it was the nicest best western I've ever stayed in... obviously that is where the "plus" comes in!
review.positiveRemarks: The beds are comfortable, reasonably quiet, and AMAZING breakfast.

review.title: Loud loud loud
review.reviewText: Airport and highway noise attack 24 hous per day, but thi old hotel too weak to defend its inhabitants.
review.positiveRemarks: Nothing. It's old run down and in need of repair. The restaurant food come straight from a can.

review.title: Easy to get to
review.reviewText: A nice, comfortable, and clean place to stay. Not particularly quite but not a lot of hotels are.
review.locationRemarks: McDonald's

review.title: airport hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed twice, one night each. The first night we were on the 4th floor and the noise from the road was unacceptable. The second time we were on the eighth floor and heard planes all night. For a so called airport hotel the sound insulation should be higher. Otherwise it was convenient.
review.positiveRemarks: shuttle ran every half hour to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: sound proof

review.title: Comfy, quiet and very clean room.
review.reviewText: The staff was friendly and helpful. They made us feel that they really cared about our stay. When we arrived we needed additional towels for the 3rd person in the room and room service immediately brought them to our room. Room was clean. Bathroom had a great fan and heat lamp. Very good hot free breakfast. Scrambled eggs, potatoes, bacon and sausage, fresh fruit, juice, coffee, hot water for tea,cold cereal options, bagels and crescent rolls. I would recommend this hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Attended a Giants game. Took a ride on a cable car and visited Pier 39 and Fisherman"s wharf.

review.title: Close to Airport
review.reviewText: The hotel is an older building that could use some updating. We chose it for its location close to SFO, and it was convenient for us to shuttle to the airport to catch our flight home the following morning. The hotel appears to do a high volume business and there was a lot of commotion in the hallways from other guests. The vending machine on our floor was out of order. Although the room had been somewhat updated, the bathroom was very small with inadequate counter space and the bathroom floor looked dirty, due to the dark, wide grout lines. More updates would be advisable.

review.title: OK hotel near SFO
review.reviewText: The hotel staff are very friendly but the hotel needs upgrade its interior to look nicer. It is ok for us to stay just one night due to early flight in the morning.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the airport with free shuttle
review.reviewText: Great staff, free shuttle which was exactly on time to get us to the airport. Clean hotel and updated rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: airport

review.title: Terrible Beds
review.reviewText: We hoped to get a good nights rest in a comfortable bed but not at this Best Western. The mattress was springy and very uncomfortable. Overall, the hotel seems old and dingy but it was close to the airport which made it easy coming into town late.

review.title: airport close by
review.reviewText: stayed overnight to catch an early morning flight to Europe.

review.title: Not a 3-Star Hotel!
review.reviewText:
I purchased a room at this hotel using Expedia's unpublished hotel option and selected a 3-star hotel near SFO. I had an early flight the next day and was looking forward to a clean, comfortable, quiet room with some food options on site. Oh boy. This is a 3-star hotel on paper only. The food and atmosphere at the "Brass Elephant" were unappealing. (I am skeptical about any restaurant at a Best Western that advertises itself as "fine dining.") I ended up not eating dinner.

The room was clean -- enough. The window was filthy and while I could handle the steady hum of traffic on the 101 and some flight noise, it was the people walking down the hallway that were the loudest and most difficult to drown out. It wasn't that the other hotel guests were being loud on purpose. They were just talking in normal voices.

A big disappointment given its 3-star rating. Urge Expedia to take another look.
review.positiveRemarks: Location near airport and free shuttle.
review.negativeRemarks: Onsite dining and atmosphere, cleanliness

review.title: Close to airport, easy to get to.
review.reviewText: The hotel is very easy to get to from the airport. So if you need to be close to the airport it's a good location. Good breakfast. The hotel and staff are just ok. If you arrive early prepare to wait until 3 before you can check in. There was no effort to even check to see if a room might be available. Most hotels try to accommodate you if you are a little early. Service was just average. Maybe they were short staffed the day I arrived but it did not seem they were happy to be working there. Parking is $7 per night which for the location I thought was excessive. It's not gated or covered and it's not a busy area like the city so parking should be included for guests. Wifi was good, easy to log on and fast. There is no charge for wifi.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking should be free. Staff could be friendlier, more welcoming.

review.title: Trouble with the address; hotel just adequate
review.reviewText: This is a hotel out of necessity and proximity to the airport, with little else to recommend it, although there were no major deficiencies. We did, however, have a problem finding the hotel. The address is given as 380 S. Airport Blvd, but the actual location is on South Airport Boulevard---'South' is part of the name, which led us on a merry chase with the GPS. Expedia (and Best Western) should take note of this issue.

review.title: I recommand this hotel to stay.
review.reviewText: Very good. nice hotel. Room was clean, and I used wifi ans parking freely.
review.negativeRemarks: I needed a coin laundry room.

review.title: Very convenient and very close to every place
review.reviewText: Kudos to John and Leah . . . Had a very good stay . . .
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient to every place we wanted to go

review.title: Pleasantly surprised
review.reviewText: Great expectations = disappointment, usually. But not here.
review.negativeRemarks: Better soundproofing. Could hear planes way too easily
review.locationRemarks: Great food in house. Nice community around block. Not easy to walk anywhere tho

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: I felt the check in clerk was very Kurt when I asked her a question regarding free breakfast that I thought was included in our rate. We have been staying at best western for about 10 years and are reward members and have always , except once, had a breakfast included in our rate. The one time it was not, we knew in advance. Apparently it depends on how you book, through AARP, Expedia or directly, but it does not specify that when booking. She also said she couldn't apply an AARP discount with the rate we already had. Her demeanor was rude in my opinion. Also when we checked in she informed us of happy hour time and said there were free drinks. The drinks were not free, but a SELECT FEW were half price.
review.positiveRemarks: Location from airport. Breakfast buffet decent ( we had to pay though). Good fresh fruit. The fact that there was a restaurant in the hotel was nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Desk clerk needs to be a little bit more hospitable.

review.title: Clean, Comfortable & Convenient
review.reviewText: Room was clean & comfortable. We were worried about noise from the airport, but did not hear anything. Great value and the drive into downtown only took about 20 minutes.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown SF is only a 15-20 minute drive.

review.title: TERRIBLE FROM THE START
review.reviewText:
There was no one at the front desk when I entered the building. When I did reach the desk, I stood there for about 45 - 60 seconds and I heard two voice, at the same time, from different directions, ask if I needed help. As I answered the person behind me (the one I noticed first), a guy appeared from a room at the front and was clearly irritated that I had not responded to him. Before I can speak he rudely asked again if I needed help. Without speaking, I handed him my, readily available, driver's licence and credit card. I believe he realized what a jerk he was being and attempted small-talk. I was already so turned off, I practically ignored him.

After the process, I gathered my things and the next person stepped to the counter. The guy was a jerk with him also. Perhaps he was having a bad day...not sure. He probably shouldn't have been working the FRONT desk with THAT attitude....just RUDE!!!
review.negativeRemarks: cleanliness and staff
review.locationRemarks: Away from everything (except the airport...I think it's right on the runway)...nothing to do nearby.

review.title: nice hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText:
.Nice, clean, up to date room in a nice location. Has a restaurant and outdoor pool.
Everything worked like it should.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to SFO, and reasonable price. It was clean and up to date.
review.negativeRemarks: Could use a microwave.
review.locationRemarks: Moderately priced hotel which is close to SFO airport with reasonable access to downtown San Francisco by car or public transportation.

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel before so we stayed this time. I don't know when they started to charge for parking and brown-bagged (complimentary) their breakfast for their guests. We paid $20 a day for parking. If you want their "free" brown-bagged breakfast, you pick them up between 4 and 6 am. In the brown bag, there's a little OJ or Capris Sun apple juice, a small pastry or caked donut, granola bar, and apple.
review.negativeRemarks: Don't make their guest get up between 4 and 6am for complimentary breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Near SFO airport.

review.title: Best Western Plus is still just best western
review.reviewText: Hotel had a funky smell upon entering the lobby. The bathroom was not clean and all through out my stay I couldn't wait to check out...We had a family vacation up north and spent two night in San Fran...this will be the last Best Western for me...the only plus was the person who checked us in by the name of John...so friendly and helpful.

review.title: Nice hotel close to airport, but nothing else.
review.reviewText: Clean comfortable beds and rooms. Breakfast at $9. extra not impressive - steam table

review.title: Nice place good price
review.reviewText: Stopped on the way into from San Francisco. Good experience, desk staff seemed rather surly but other than that we had a good stay. Room was clean with a nice layout, bathroom was old but functional and clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Desk staff
review.locationRemarks: Airport, See's candies next door, McDonald's across the street, and 10 minute drive into San Francisico.

review.title: avearge quality consistent with the price
review.reviewText:
Close to airport but in a mostly "industrial" neighborhood,
regular (and punctual) airport shuttle service
Average amenities in the room
review.locationRemarks: Not much

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: Toilet did not flush correctly. Not all of the lights worked. Phone did not work so not able to get a wake up call. Ordered a roll away bed and it had stained sheets.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything needs improvement. Especially since it was $184.00 for the night with an additional $7.00 fee for parking and a $15.00 feefor roll away
review.locationRemarks: Near airport

review.title: the hotel is old and outdated
review.reviewText: from my room I can hear planes very loudly landing and departing

review.title: decent hotel
review.reviewText: It Was Ok ButThe Building Is Outdated. The Breakfast Was Good.

photos.caption: Stained glass and timber in the Brass Elephant Bar

review.title: San Francisco Surprise
review.reviewText: We decided to stay near the airport and take advantage of the free shuttle service to the airport and access to the BART system to downtown San Francisco. It was a great decision and made our short stay even more enjoyable.
review.positiveRemarks: It was a step back in time with the stained glass panels and timber flooring adding to its charm. The cooked breakfast was great.
review.negativeRemarks: No complaints at all.
review.locationRemarks: 10 minutes from the airport was perfect for us. The shuttles are frequent and easily accessible and the drivers are wonderful.

review.title: Great for the family.
review.reviewText: Very friendly, answered all our questions, clean rooms. Easy to get to the Airport.
review.locationRemarks: Great location.

review.title: Nice but old
review.reviewText: Arrived overnight to a mess of a room. Someone left the hot water running in bathtub and room was full of moisture. We did get a new room right away, bathroom is very old and gave the appearance to be dirty. We were there just to sleep overnight and left next morning as scheduled. The day shift crew was much nicer than the overnight crew and did allow us to leave our luggage in storage for free while we went sightseeing. The lobby area is very modern and pretty, they need to spend that money on the upkeep of the rooms. Also shuttle to and from airport is very convenient as you can take train from airport to downtown San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Old bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Convenient location, close to airport, IHOP, and other restaurants.

review.title: Best Western Plus Grosvenor Airport Hotel
review.reviewText: I needed to be close to the airport. The facilities met my needs exactly..... Courteous staff, Wifi, a choice of restaurant or bar with snacks for a quick evening meal, a bagged breakfast to go in the early morning and a shuttle to and from the airport......very satisfactory

review.title: OK for one night stay
review.reviewText:
The shuttle does not run often enough. We counted others and ours came after several runs by many other hotels. It was cold! The driver was not very pleasant.
Bathrooms very small. Makes it hard for more than 2 people to get ready.Floors were not real clean. Tub was re-grouted but still looked dirty in places and old.
Evening staff very nice but morning breakfast greeter was VERY gruff and unpleasant. Our friends did not receive a wake up call as requested. No one seemed to care.
This is an OK hotel for a one night stay but not for a family or long stays. Airplanes fly late and early. Know you can not help that but a person on vacation would not want many nights and mornings of that.
Would be nice if a bar menu were avaiable until it closed( for late arrivals.)
review.positiveRemarks: Check-in person was very pleasant. Bed was comfortable. Close to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Shuttle service was disappointing. Bathroom small and not as clean as it could be. SOME of the staff not very pleasant.

review.title: Pleasant Hotel Experience!
review.reviewText: Our experience at the Best Western Plus Grovenor was good. We found it's location to be convenient. It's close to major freeways, 20 mins from down town San Francisco. Our rooms were nice and very clean, which made us feel comfort. The staffs response to our needs was quick and pleasant. The hotel is slighty outdated, however this can be overlooked due to it's excellent upkeep. Good value for our dollar. We will stay here again!

review.title: Mattresses need upgrade
review.reviewText:
Basic Airport Hotel. Good price but very average. Good location.
Mattresses need upgrading. The springs are starting to be felt. Not good.

review.title: Near the airport. Quiet. Not much else.
review.reviewText: I got to the hotel late after a long flight. I didn't care too much about surroundings or ambiance since I was there to crash in anticipation of a busy day the next day. The hotel was fine for that purpose. For someone who's there during the day, you might wish that it had been renovated and that there was more across the street than just a McDonalds.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything else.
review.locationRemarks: McDonald's is nearby.

review.title: Nice and absolutely value for money.
review.reviewText: Location is fantastic considering proximity to Universal and adventure theme parks. After an exciting day at parks the hotel offers a relaxing and quiet rooms and surroundings

review.title: Decent hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was decent and for a decent price compared to others. Everything you would expect.

review.title: Worst Customer Service Ever!
review.reviewText: First of all, my main reason for booking a hotel out of the city was to save money but the amount of money you spend on the bus (there are three different transportation systems so your transfers will most likely not work if youre doing all the tourist things we did) and thee the Bart (the most cost efficient). The reviews I read and the hotels sites said this was close to or 15 minutes from Dt San Fran, by bus it was closer to 45 minutes and Bart though more cost efficient (the $16.50 will get you to and from Dt to the hotel using the airport shuttle) it was still a long way from this hotel to SF. That being said the gentleman who checked us in was nice and..that is where the customer service stopped. We would not be greeted on any of comings and goings from the hotel, one gent actually came out of the back office and asked 'checking in?' and my Mother (by the way this was a Mothers day gift and I'm luck she has not worked in hospitality or she would have been as upset as I was at the horrible customer service), when she responded 'nope just going up to our room', he said nothing and walked back into the back room... REALLY!?. The room was nice, no complaints there. Taking the shuttle to the airport and then Bart as I said was the most cost effective, we only encountered one driver that was polite and let us know where we were going as there are many stops before you get to the international terminal where Bart is, this was on our last full day, he was the only one that we
review.positiveRemarks: The only thing that was acceptable was our room, it was clean and comfy
review.locationRemarks: There is nothing near by and even though you save a little money by staying out of the city the amount of money we spent on transportation evened out

review.title: comfortable but not the suite.
review.reviewText: very happy with our stay at the hotel. The couch in the suite needs to be replaced asap. Just wires to sleep on. Bad couch.

review.title: Hotel at SFO
review.reviewText: General upkeep was poor. The hair dryer stopped working. There was no one to help with the baggage. For the price you pay, what you get is not worth.

review.title: Convenient to airport, but some disappointment.
review.reviewText: The hotel is close to the airport, which is why I chose it. The room was clean and pleasant, although a little cluttered (a small table that really served no purpose except to eat up space). The bathroom was also clean. The main complaint was with personnel. When we arrived, there were 2 people at the reception desk - one was helping someone and the other had just finished helping another. She saw us waiting and said that she'd be right back and went into the back. A few minutes passed without her coming back out and the other staff person had to go back and ask her to come out and help, as he was still busy. When she did help us, she was pleasant, so we assumed it was just a blip. We asked for a wake up call during check in, which she acknowledged, but we never got it the next morning. Thankfully, we had also set the alarm clock in the room or we may have slept longer than desired. This was very annoying. The other issue we had was the extremely limited channel selection. There were about 16 TV channels - mostly news or sports. There is no complimentary breakfast - not anything negative, just something to be aware of.
review.negativeRemarks: Customer service, although our experience may not be typical.
review.locationRemarks: This hotel was selected due to its proximity to the airport, so we weren't concerned with nearby attractions.

review.title: Clean hotel perfect for brief stays in SF
review.reviewText: Good hotel at a very reasonable price. Proximity to SFO airport (less than 15 minutes) makes for a very convenient stay on a brief layover or when passing through. Not necesasarily the best choice for a long stay in SF due to the distance from downtown and most of the sights but is very clean and comfortable for the price.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to the SFO airport, very reasonably priced, and very clean/well maintained
review.negativeRemarks: Located in a sketchy part of South San Fran and a long distance from downtown and the BART would be difficult for longer stays.
review.locationRemarks: Located in South SF, the surrounding area isn't overly appealing BUT very close to the airport. McDonalds and IHop within a block.

review.title: Great hotel.
review.reviewText: Stayed here with family on a trip to San Francisco. short drive to city. Clean rooms. Flat screen tv. Comfortable beds. Overall clean look. Friendly staff. Would stay here again

review.title: Good location for access to SFO
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed the bed and the breakfast that was included. Did not know this until the morning but that was okay.
review.negativeRemarks: There was a noise complaint made to us so maybe a bit more sound proofing wouldn't hurt.

review.title: Great hotel for business travellers
review.reviewText: Great hotel for the price. But choose the double beds room or the king room. Queen room is too small. Staff is real nice. There is a restaurant next to lobby which is open in the evening. Decent. Ba'ath rooms are really clean. They also provide lotion in toiletries. Bed was little hard. They have a flat screen tv. Not much channels. You will find a freshly cleaned remote when u arrive at room. Break fast was also great although they add surcharge of $9 . Rooms have auto climate control thermostat. Wireless is little spotty. They also provide free shuttle to airport. Its next to a free way so gets little noisy. I had a great time during my stay. I loved this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Next to free way.little noisy
review.locationRemarks: Very close to sfo airport.

review.title: Good location to sfo
review.reviewText: Very noisey. Heat/air conditioning kept going on and off you could hear traffic. Location was convenient

review.title: You might want to look elsewhere
review.reviewText:
Perhaps I've been away from the area too long but this hotel looked more like a typical two-story motel. The look and feel of the hotel reminded me of a two-star motel and not a four-star hotel. The so-called lake side view is a four feet wide canal full of water with a waterfall (far cry from a lake). The facility was under renovation so that was an inconvenience but, I suppose that will eventually stop.
No breakfast, not even a cold breakfast available at the lobby.
The staff was okay but nothing extraordinary. Overall, in my opinion it was not money well-spent. I could have done better with a different choice.
Best,
Mr. O.C

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: convenient location to airport and BART. good shuttle service to airport and BART station.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: Lobby was pleasant but the rooms seemed cramped. One telephone in the room did not work at all and the other malfunctioned. Plus, the hotel FAILED to deliver our wake-up call. It was lucky that I awoke on my own and did not miss my plane. Further, while we appreciate the van service to the airport, the driver was ill-informed about which terminal our flight was taking off from. It is lucky I did NOT listen to his recommendation.
review.negativeRemarks: wake up call.
review.locationRemarks: Located in the typical no-man's land that surrounds metropolitan airports.

review.title: Decent but dated
review.reviewText:
We picked this hotel because it was located only 15 minutes away from our family in Brisbane. It was an easy hop on and off the 101 fwy. Not much by way of food options but most good places were within a short drive (~no more than 10 minutes) away for some decent food.
Hotel itself isn't bad. Although dated, it was pretty clean. No stains on the carpet at least. The beds were comfy, and I prefer a firmer bed. Again, the hotel is dated, so the bathroom was also dated. The hotel and cleaning staff were nice.
All in all, not too bad for what you pay for.

review.title: Bad customer service
review.reviewText: we drove all the way from LA with family, two adult and two kids, when we reach on the front desk, this lady named Ruberta was there. She started to look our reservation and gave us looks, I do not know what she was doing she started working on her computer and it took her about 40 minutes to just check us in, when we already booked. we were tired and with kids, she did not even care, and we saw the other front desk person was pretty fast and while we were waiting, he checked in about four families. and it was very frustrating. Very bad customer service.

review.title: Decent, but meh.
review.reviewText: It is a decent choice for business travelers. Nothing outstanding or memorable...

review.title: Like proximity to airport
review.reviewText: Choose the hotel because of its close proximity to the airport, perfect, the shuttle was on time in the morning to bring us to the airport. Food in the restaurant was good.

review.title: Just a hotel...
review.reviewText: Not bad if you just want to spend one night near SFO.
review.negativeRemarks: It was not a clean hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Near airport.

review.title: Good for business and an overnight stay.Free
review.reviewText: The outside of the hotel is a little tacky looking as is the entrance a bit dark and 1970s looking. However the room is much nicer and far better internally than the exterior indicates. This is unusual as most hotels have a good lobby but the rooms can be disappointing. The staff were polite and friendly and a good room. Good value for money.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the airport but not too noisy

review.title: ONE GREAT ROOM, ONE NOT SO GREAT.
review.reviewText: We rented two rooms, connecting, and our son's room, at the same price, was much smaller. Don't think that is fair to charge the same price when one room is quite a bit smaller than the other. They were very nice; well furnished, clean, and attractive. The restaurant in the hotel was very good. One HUGE problem was that we couldn't get the air conditioner to turn off as it was either too cold or too warm.
review.negativeRemarks:
The lousy air conditioner. (room 601)

The lousy air conditioner in room 601

the lousy air conditioner
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for overnight before morning flight.

review.title: Good experience
review.reviewText: We had a quick overnight layover in San Francisco and this was a good choice for an overnight stay. Property was in good shape, staff courteous and friendly, and the shuttle was a plus. We would look to stay here again.

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: Ok for early departure out of SFO. Close to airport.

review.title: Need to pay for parking!
review.reviewText:
Pretty nice hotel which is close to the airport.

However, you need to pay for parking, which is really unpleasant!
review.negativeRemarks: need to pay for parking!
review.locationRemarks: close to SFO

review.title: Didn't get room I booked
review.reviewText: I didn't get the room I booked, and no explanation as to why not. Disappointing (supposed to be an upgrade on 9th floor, ended up in standard room on 2nd floor).

review.title: good airport hotel
review.reviewText: convenient for the airport, clean and comfortable. Staff was helpful.

review.title: Good compromise between cost and location
review.reviewText: Pleasing hotel conveniently located between San Francisco city and its airport

review.title: Love this hotel
review.reviewText: Everybody was so friendly and nice. My kids and I had an fantastic time there. This isn't our first stay. It's like a little vacation:)
review.positiveRemarks: Room service, comfy bed, room for my 16 month old twins to walk around in, breakfast staff
review.negativeRemarks: Na

review.title: Avoid at all costs
review.reviewText: This is the worst hotel I ever stayed at. I arrived close to midnight,unpacked and got ready to go to bed only to discover the toilet was stopped up. the desk clerk came, handed me a plunger and told me to fix it. I declined and when he couldn't get it to work, I was forced to get dressed, repack and move to another room. I immediately went to bed, but the next morning found that that toilet did not work either. In addition, the free wi-fi was broken. I quickly checked out.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything

review.title: Not bad, but not very good
review.reviewText: The clearness of bathroom was a little bad, so I did not feel confortable for everthing. However, the cost of the hotel and the airport shuttle were good.
review.negativeRemarks: clearness
review.locationRemarks: near the airport

review.title: Get what you pay for
review.reviewText: I just stayed for one night and had a corner unit. The hotel is a bit run down but the bed was comfortable and I did have a restful sleep. They were kind enough the to not charge me for parking overnight - I appreciated that. The bathroom can really use an update. The counters are loose and angled and the tiles in the bathroom really need to be replaced. The tv is the old tube type-- I hadn't seen those in a while. I stayed at the holiday inn express across the street previously and I'd stay there again instead of here. The price is a bit more but the room is more modern.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom needs update
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport. Costco across the street.

review.title: Review of 12-7-12 stay
review.reviewText: It was a smaller room than I would have liked. The only annoying part of my stay was being woken up early by housekeeping knocking on other doors and being excessively loud.

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: Check in was very smooth.Anna at thermometers was very friendly and helpful.Convenient to San Francisco airport.

review.title: Weekend Get Away
review.reviewText:
We found it a great experience. The hotel had somewhat of a smell to it in the rooms that seemed to us like an old building type of smell.

OTher than that things were just great! Thank you so much, we would recommend your hotel to our friends for sure.

review.title: Quick trip to airport
review.reviewText: Location was handy to airport. The floor I was on was being painted. Signs hanging everywhere. Not very appealing.

review.title: Great location but noisy
review.reviewText: I asked for a quiet room as I had to catch an early morning flight. I was disappointed in what I was assured was a quiet room. The noise level in the hallways was quite loud. The walls were quite thin and I was able to hear conversations going on in the next room. Also, even though there is no smoking, I could smell the smoke seeping under the adjoining door.
review.positiveRemarks: Provided a grab and go breakfast free of charge
review.negativeRemarks: thin walls and noise level in hallways
review.locationRemarks: Good location for airport access

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel for the price. Clean rooms ;although noisy. No customer service except at the check-in/check-out counter. Don't expect any valet; or anyone to help you with your bags. Had to park far away from entry door - and drag my heavy bags through the dark parking lot to finally get inside the door! There was one really nice older gentleman working in the restaurant during breakfast - he was so very kind, helpful, and considerate.
review.positiveRemarks: Kind gentleman in restaurant during breakfast. (I think he was the only one there).
review.negativeRemarks: No valet/people at the front door to help with bags. Parking lot was full; had to park far away and drag 4 heavy bags by myself to entry of hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Near SFO airport.

review.title: Good to stay during layover
review.reviewText: Everything was clean but not a lot of food places nearby and cable only had espn and hbo. Very limited number of channels.

review.title: Good Value for Money
review.reviewText: Excellent breakfast and location. Very near to San Francisco city downtown Union Square. Just 20 minutes driving.
review.locationRemarks: Very good shuttle service

review.title: Decent and clean, but not long-term.
review.reviewText:
To be fair they were in the middle of remodeling (painting on our floor).
The buffet in the morning was decent, but service horrible if you had a question.
The major complaint was the road noise. I thought the window was open, but it wasn't.
We stayed to be close to the airport and I'm glad it was just one night.

review.title: needs work
review.reviewText:
Grossly understaffed
Needs complete refurb

Breakfast marginal

review.title: Adequate
review.reviewText: Adequate for travelers who need quick access to the airport, but it is located in an industrial park. Walking around the hotel is not very exciting because of its location.
review.positiveRemarks: Free Shuttle to Airport and BART
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing withing walking distance to see; it is in an industrial park,
review.locationRemarks: Adequate for travelers who need quick access to the airport

review.title: Best hotel near airport.
review.reviewText: Very comfortable, clean accommodations. The staff are friendly and go out of their way to be helpful. The breakfast buffet is above standard...with wonderful fresh fruits cut up and hot options...eggs, meats, oatmeal, etc. I would say good value for a quick overnight stay. It is great if you are in need of a place near the airport and want to make use of the free shuttle.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable beds, free wi-fi and a welcoming atmosphere...fruit, coffees, tea, water is available as soon as you walk in.
review.negativeRemarks: The restaurant didn't open until 5:30 p.m. and we arrived early, hadn't had lunch yet. There are no good nearby restaurants.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent accessibility to the airport with in time frequent free shuttle service.

review.title: Great location but tired
review.reviewText: Great location for airport. Somewhat tired, but OK for the price

review.title: We would stay again if visiting the San-Fran area!
review.reviewText: This hotel is very convenient to travelers in relationship to the SF airport. Hotel and restaurant staff were courteous and helpful. Our room was always clean and comfortable. The hotel was quiet as well, eventough all rooms were booked up each night of our stay!

review.title: Nice hotel near airport
review.reviewText: Great location- easy to find= hotel has nice restaurant on premises.
review.positiveRemarks: location and restaurant we did not have to drive around looking for a place to eat
review.negativeRemarks: we did hear some of the planes landing or taking off
review.locationRemarks: not far from the car return facility and airport

review.title: Great place to rest.
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff. Can't complain. I do recommend this hotel plus it's so close to the SFO!

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: The hotel was conveniently located close to the airport and rental car drop-off location. The transportation to and from the terminals was efficient. We had no complaints and enjoyed our brief stay.

review.title: slightly bright hotel with great staff
review.reviewText: Room was slightly outdated and wasn't spotless. Plus the room was too bright. The staff was very helpful and friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Not completely clean, outdated
review.locationRemarks: In an average part of town. No restaurants around it.

review.title: Great economy hotel for the dough!
review.reviewText: Loved the charm of this place. Cool old-style lobby. Small room, but it suited me just fine! Loved the bfast buffet in the morning for $8.95. Staff friendly as well.
review.positiveRemarks: buffet. small room with desk. wi-fi to do business and catch up on emails. Quiet for a good night;s sleep!
review.negativeRemarks: Eh....not really a complaint, but maybe the view from my room could've been better...and directions how I can adjust the heat.
review.locationRemarks: perfect for my business needs, and within walking distance to area restaurants, like The Hungry Hunter.

review.title: look around don't stay here
review.reviewText: It was very run down ,we had two rooms they were both non smoking but both smelled of old smoke. staff were unfriendly. location was good but I would look for a newer hotel in area I could see new ones from my window
